While lacking in constant action, the show's gripping storytelling, well-rounded characters, and beautiful animation make it a must-watch for any anime fan, earning it high praise and a strong recommendation.

metadata.name: The God of High School
metadata.original_name: THE GOD OF HIGH SCHOOL ゴッド・オブ・ハイスクール
metadata.overview: When an island half-disappears from the face of the earth, a mysterious organization sends out invitations for a tournament to every skilled fighter in the world. "If you win you can have ANYTHING you want," they claim. They're recruiting only the best to fight the best and claim the title of The God of High School. Jin Mori, a Taekwondo specialist and a high school student, soon learns that there is something much greater beneath the stage of the tournament.

analysis.summary: While the series excels in delivering fast-paced, visually stunning fight scenes with realistic martial arts choreography, its rapid pacing and lack of depth in characters and narrative leave much to be desired. Despite its shortcomings, the anime offers an enjoyable ride for fans of action-packed sequences, showcasing top-notch animation and memorable fight set pieces.

metadata.description: Hades is a rogue-like dungeon crawler in which you defy the god of death as you hack and slash your way out of the Underworld of Greek myth.
metadata.title: Hades

analysis.summary: I absolutely love the art style and music, the narrative and characters are well-written, and the depth of gameplay with various builds and mechanics is incredibly rewarding. The only minor downside is the controller's auto-aim, which can be turned off, and compared to another game, the character diversity isn't as pronounced, but overall, it's an outstanding and extraordinary experience.

metadata.title: The Devil All the Time
metadata.overview: In Knockemstiff, Ohio and its neighboring backwoods, sinister characters converge around young Arvin Russell as he fights the evil forces that threaten him and his family.

analysis.summary: I found the movie's exploration of religion's influence intriguing, with a stacked cast delivering solid performances despite occasional pacing issues. While some plot lines felt weaker and the narrator seemed unnecessary, the film's tense moments and unflinching portrayal of its themes made it an enjoyable experience overall.

metadata.title: Mulan
metadata.overview: To save her father from certain death in the army, a young woman secretly enlists in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.

metadata.description: This DLC for LEGO Marvel Avengers includes:
metadata.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Marvel's Ant-Man Pack

analysis.summary: While the game is well-made and objectively good, I found it to be passionless and uninspired, with repetitive gameplay and forgettable narrative tropes. The combat lacks excitement and variety despite attempts at flashy combos, and the multiplayer component doesn't elevate the experience significantly. Overall, it's a forgettably average game that may appeal to some but left me feeling underwhelmed.

While the game offers a challenging experience, especially with mouse and keyboard controls, and enjoyable multiplayer, it lacks innovation in utilizing the gaming medium fully and could benefit from introducing more fantastical elements in future iterations. Despite its limitations, it delivers a satisfying golfing experience with creative character customization options.

metadata.description: Risk of Rain 1 + 2 is a compilation of:
metadata.title: Risk of Rain 1 + 2

analysis.summary: I thoroughly enjoyed the diverse characters and their unique playstyles, as well as the satisfying loot system and challenging gameplay. Despite occasional frustrations with RNG, the game's replayability, versatility in character builds, and incredible soundtrack make it a standout experience in the genre.

metadata.description: Yuri and Chelinka between them share a special mystical gift that allows them to control a magical crystal. When a mysterious robed figure appears in their small town, murders their father, and causes their two faithful friends to disappear, the pair must explore the countryside to rescue their friends. From there, it's a matter of confronting the sinister temple in the city which seems to be the center of all of this trouble.
metadata.title: Final Fantasy: Crystal Chronicles - Ring of Fates

analysis.summary: This game is a complete disaster with terrible visuals, nonsensical storytelling, and lackluster gameplay. Despite its abysmal quality, it's so laughably bad that it crosses into the realm of being amusing to ridicule, offering some entertainment value in its sheer awfulness.

metadata.name: The Umbrella Academy
metadata.overview: A dysfunctional family of superheroes comes together to solve the mystery of their father's death, the threat of the apocalypse and more.

analysis.summary: The second season offers strong character development and interactions, particularly with standout performances from Five, Diego, and Reginald, while also delivering engaging action sequences and intriguing stylistic choices. However, some narrative inconsistencies, repetitive squabbles among the characters, and underutilization of certain characters detract from the overall experience, despite still providing an enjoyable super-powered ride.

metadata.description: This Collector's Edition includes:
metadata.title: Fall Guys: Collector's Edition

metadata.description: This compilation includes:
metadata.title: Destroy All Humans! 2: Reprobed - Dressed to Skill Edition

analysis.summary: The game's narrative and character development receive high praise, with enjoyable side quests contributing to a rich story experience. However, repetitive missions, particularly trailing missions, and frustrating camera mechanics detract from the overall enjoyment despite the game's fun combat and engaging world design.

metadata.name: Agent Hamilton
metadata.overview: Carl Hamilton has just returned to Sweden after many years of secret education in the US when Stockholm is shaken by a series of terrorist attacks. Hamilton is assigned to assist the Swedish intelligence service in their pursuit of the guilty, but at the same time works as a double agent.

metadata.description: Six tough events await in this joystick-waggling successor to Track &Field.
metadata.title: Hyper Sports

analysis.summary: The game's emphasis on aggressive play and fast-paced action is praised, offering a refreshing approach to the battle royale genre. However, issues like repetitive events and bugs detract from the overall experience, while the integrated stream feature feels gimmicky and frustrating. Despite its flaws, it provides a fun and casual shooter experience.

metadata.name: Tower of God
metadata.overview: Reach the top, and everything will be yours. At the top of the tower exists everything in this world, and all of it can be yours. You can become a god. This is the story of the beginning and the end of Rachel, the girl who climbed the tower so she could see the stars, and Bam, the boy who needed nothing but her.

analysis.summary: Tower of God stands out with its unique visuals and stunning soundtrack, offering a compelling story with well-written characters and intriguing mysteries. While the action scenes are somewhat lacking, the narrative depth and character development more than make up for it, making it an extremely strong show overall.

videos.title: SpongeBob SquarePants: Battle for Bikini Bottom - Rehydrated

metadata.description: Command a squadron of rebel pilots to outfly and outsmart the Terran Overlord Government invasion force.
metadata.title: Renegade: Battle for Jacob's Star

analysis.summary: The game offers a fun and nostalgic experience with its collectathon gameplay, recognizable levels from the show, and enjoyable missions. While it has some clunky controls and occasional glitches, it remains a wholesome and entertaining game that holds up well in the modern age, especially for fans of the original.

metadata.description: The pre-order release of The Last of Us Part II includes additional DLC bonus content not available as standalone.
metadata.title: The Last of Us: Part II

analysis.summary: The game delivers impressive cinematic set pieces and engaging scripted encounters, but suffers from lazy boss battles with repetitive movesets and a narrative that falls flat, lacking depth and emotional impact. Its attempt to evoke emotion through predictable tropes like pregnancy and animal involvement feels forced and amateurish, resulting in a disappointing sequel to its predecessor.

metadata.title: The King of Staten Island
metadata.overview: Scott has been a case of arrested development ever since his firefighter father died when he was seven. He's now reached his mid-20s having achieved little, chasing a dream of becoming a tattoo artist that seems far out of reach. As his ambitious younger sister heads off to college, Scott is still living with his exhausted ER nurse mother and spends his days smoking weed, hanging with the guys — Oscar, Igor and Richie — and secretly hooking up with his childhood friend Kelsey. But when his mother starts dating a loudmouth firefighter named Ray, it sets off a chain of events that will force Scott to grapple with his grief and take his first tentative steps toward moving forward in life.

metadata.title: Love Birds
metadata.overview: Sometimes the best things in life happen on the fly. From the moment an injured duck crash-lands on Doug's roof, everything changes. Recently dumped and wallowing in self pity, Doug decides to nurse Pierre back to health with the assistance of an eccentric vet and bird specialist, Holly.

analysis.summary: While this movie follows a generic rom-com plotline and feels rushed at times, the strong performances of the two leads carry the film, making it an enjoyable watch for a casual viewing experience at home. The convenience of streaming on Netflix adds to its appeal despite its shortcomings.

While the game successfully offers a simple and fun ARPG experience in the style of Diablo, it suffers from significant bugs and glitches, particularly on mouse and keyboard, detracting from the overall enjoyment. However, the game's charming aesthetic and varied weapons contribute to its appeal, making it an enjoyable casual gaming experience despite its flaws.

metadata.title: Scoob!
metadata.overview: In Scooby-Doo’s greatest adventure yet, see the never-before told story of how lifelong friends Scooby and Shaggy first met and how they joined forces with young detectives Fred, Velma, and Daphne to form the famous Mystery Inc. Now, with hundreds of cases solved, Scooby and the gang face their biggest, toughest mystery ever: an evil plot to unleash the ghost dog Cerberus upon the world. As they race to stop this global “dogpocalypse,” the gang discovers that Scooby has a secret legacy and an epic destiny greater than anyone ever imagined.

analysis.summary: While the movie is criticized by some for being geared toward kids and lacking depth, it delivers a fun and enjoyable adventure in line with the classic Scooby-Doo formula. Despite some complaints about animation quality and voice casting, it remains a cute and entertaining film that hits familiar beats for fans of the franchise.

metadata.title: Extraction
metadata.overview: Tyler Rake, a fearless mercenary who offers his services on the black market, embarks on a dangerous mission when he is hired to rescue the kidnapped son of a Mumbai crime lord.

analysis.summary: While the movie lacks depth in plot and characters, it excels in delivering top-notch, high-octane action sequences reminiscent of John Wick. Chris Hemsworth's performance adds depth despite the character's simplicity, and although some CGI moments feel rushed, it remains a highly entertaining film, especially for action enthusiasts.

metadata.name: Black Clover
metadata.overview: Asta and Yuno are two orphans who want the same thing: to become the Wizard King. Locked in a friendly rivalry, they work hard towards their goal. While Yuno excels at magic, Asta has a problem uncommon in this world: he has no powers! But, on the day they receive their grimoires, they surprise everyone. To reach their goal, they’ll each find their own path to greatness—with or without magic.

analysis.summary: While the show initially struggles with generic anime cliches and one-dimensional characters, it gradually improves with engaging action scenes and character development. Despite lacking originality, it successfully combines elements from various anime genres into an entertaining package that offers thrilling fights and enjoyable character dynamics.

metadata.description: Barbie Beach Vacation takes her and her friends to the the sands and the waves of a remote island. Like most Barbie titles, it's geared towards 5-9 year olds.
metadata.title: Barbie Beach Vacation

analysis.summary: I love the fast-paced action and fun gameplay of Valorant, especially enjoying the chaotic antics of my favorite agent, despite some of her abilities feeling out of place. Riot's commitment to updates and addressing player feedback is commendable, but the intrusive anti-cheat system and unbalanced maps like Split are major drawbacks.

metadata.description: The Deluxe Edition comes in a box and includes:
metadata.title: Final Fantasy VII: Remake (Deluxe Edition)

analysis.summary: While I appreciate the direction of the game and its charming voice acting, I found the execution lacking, especially with tedious enemy encounters and pacing issues. Despite flaws like narrative decisions and blatant padding, the game still delivers an extraordinary experience that was worth the wait.

metadata.description: Resident Evil 3 takes place during the events of Resident Evil 2. The midwestern town of Raccoon City is in ruins, having been overrun with the undead creating T-virus thanks to the wacky hijinks of William Birkin and Umbrella Inc. The player must guide Jill "master of unlocking" Valentine (one of the two main protagonists of the original Resident Evil) out of the city alive. Along the way, Jill will interact with and receive help from (or be hindered by) three Umbrella mercenaries who are also stranded in Raccoon City. Standing in the way of your group's last escape are a horde of flesh-eating zombified citizens, homicidal mutants, and a relentless killing machine known only as Nemesis who is determined to hunt down and kill the survivors of the original Resident Evil, including Jill.
metadata.title: Resident Evil 3: Nemesis

analysis.summary: While the gameplay loop is familiar and enjoyable, the reliance on inventory management and bullet sponge enemies can be frustrating. The narrative starts strong but loses steam in the second half, and the short length may not justify the price for some players. Despite its flaws, it still provides a decent experience overall.

metadata.name: Tiger King
metadata.overview: A zoo owner spirals out of control amid a cast of eccentric characters in this true murder-for-hire story from the underworld of big cat breeding.

analysis.summary: Tiger King delivers a wild and entertaining ride, despite some overhyped expectations. While showcasing a dark and eye-opening story, it lacks clear heroes and offers unexpected twists. Overall, it's a highly engaging and well-produced documentary worth watching.

Animal Crossing: New Horizons offers a highly customizable and relaxing experience with endless possibilities for creativity, despite its slow pacing at the beginning. The game's charm lies in its laid-back gameplay and the ability to share the experience with others, making it enjoyable even for non-gamers. While some may find the slow progression tedious, the depth of customization and personalization makes it a standout title.

metadata.description: This edition exclusive to Amazon.co.uk contains:
metadata.title: Doom Eternal (Amazon.co.uk Edition)

analysis.summary: Doom Eternal offers exhilarating and challenging gameplay with well-designed maps and a thrilling narrative that complements the action. While the multiplayer feels like an afterthought and lacks the depth of the campaign, it doesn't detract from the overall excellence of the game. With outstanding level design, a killer soundtrack, and intense combat, it's a must-play for fans of high-paced first-person shooters.

metadata.title: The Hunt
metadata.overview: Twelve strangers wake up in a clearing. They don't know where they are—or how they got there. In the shadow of a dark internet conspiracy theory, ruthless elitists gather at a remote location to hunt humans for sport. But their master plan is about to be derailed when one of the hunted turns the tables on her pursuers.

analysis.summary: While the movie offers enjoyable action scenes and a strong performance from Betty Gilpin, it suffers from heavy-handed political humor and dialogue that detracts from the overall experience. Despite its inoffensive nature and attempts at balance, the excessive focus on politics may leave many viewers feeling underwhelmed and embarrassed.

metadata.title: Onward
metadata.overview: In a suburban fantasy world, two teenage elf brothers embark on an extraordinary quest to discover if there is still a little magic left out there.

metadata.name: The Invisible Man
metadata.overview:
The Invisible Man is a Sci-Fi American television series starring Vincent Ventresca, Paul Ben-Victor, Eddie Jones, Shannon Kenny and Michael McCafferty. Somewhat more successful than previous television series involving invisible secret agents, it aired from June 9, 2000 to February 1, 2002, lasting two seasons.

The plot revolves around Darien Fawkes, a thief facing life imprisonment who was recruited by a low-rent spy organization and given the power of invisibility via implantation of a special "Quicksilver gland" in his head. The gland allows Fawkes to secrete a light-bending substance called "Quicksilver" from his pores and follicles. The substance quickly coats his skin, hair, nails and clothes and renders him invisible. He can consciously release the Quicksilver, which then flakes off and disintegrates. However, the Quicksilver gland was sabotaged at its creation by scientist Arnaud DeFehrn to release a neurotoxin that accumulates in the bloodstream and causes intense pain, followed by antisocial behavior and psychosis. The host requires regular doses of "counteragent" to keep him sane and healthy, which is controlled by said government agency. This series lasted for two seasons, before being cancelled due to cost issues and internal bickering between the Sci Fi Channel and its then-parent company, USA Networks. The show's first season ran concurrently in first-run syndication as well as on Sci Fi.

analysis.summary: Despite lackluster trailers, the film surprises with clever writing and strong performances, particularly from Elizabeth Moss. While some jump scares feel cheap, the menacing presence of the antagonist is well-executed, though the ending veers slightly into silliness. Overall, a solid and enjoyable movie experience.

metadata.title: My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising
metadata.original_title: 僕のヒーローアカデミア THE MOVIE ヒーローズ：ライジング
metadata.overview: Class 1-A visits Nabu Island where they finally get to do some real hero work. The place is so peaceful that it's more like a vacation … until they're attacked by a villain with an unfathomable Quirk! His power is eerily familiar, and it looks like Shigaraki had a hand in the plan. But with All Might retired and citizens' lives on the line, there's no time for questions. Deku and his friends are the next generation of heroes, and they're the island's only hope.

analysis.summary: Despite a weak narrative and some wasted potential with new villains, the movie shines with its focus on showcasing the entire class and delivering a memorable, over-the-top experience. The final fight, though lengthy, is gorgeously animated and filled with satisfying hero moments, making it a very enjoyable addition to the franchise.

metadata.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
metadata.overview: Powered with incredible speed, Sonic The Hedgehog embraces his new home on Earth. That is, until Sonic sparks the attention of super-uncool evil genius Dr. Robotnik. Now it’s super-villain vs. super-sonic in an all-out race across the globe to stop Robotnik from using Sonic’s unique power for world domination.

metadata.name: Birds of Prey
metadata.overview:
The series is set in New Gotham City, several years after it has been apparently abandoned by Batman. In his absence, Huntress, Oracle and Dinah are now the protectors of New Gotham: the Birds of Prey, and had taken over his war on crime.  They are joined by Alfred Pennyworth, who serves Helena as she is heir to the Wayne estate; and Detective Jesse Reese, a police officer confronted with crimes and abilities he cannot explain.

A central feature of the series is the concept of metahumans: individuals born with powers that cannot be explained. No two metahumans have the same abilities (unless hereditary), and there exists a whole subculture of metahuman society that the outside world knows nothing about.

analysis.summary: Despite some flaws in storytelling and overuse of humor, the movie offers enjoyable action scenes and a strong performance from the lead actress. It avoids the pitfalls of some reboots with its approach to characters and themes, making it an all-around enjoyable watch.

metadata.name: The Gentlemen
metadata.overview: When aristocratic Eddie inherits the family estate, he discovers that it's home to an enormous weed empire — and its proprietors aren't going anywhere.

analysis.summary: The movie pleasantly surprised me with its strong performances, engaging narrative, and enjoyable characters. While it had some flaws in predictability and an unnecessary extended ending, overall it was a solid and satisfying experience with great comedic moments.

While I enjoyed the cheesy story and the gameplay mechanics, the open world felt barren and the side missions were often tedious fetch quests, leading to a lack of value in the game's length. However, the main story missions provided more XP and better rewards, making them more worthwhile.

metadata.title: Bad Boys for Life
metadata.overview: Marcus and Mike are forced to confront new threats, career changes, and midlife crises as they join the newly created elite team AMMO of the Miami police department to take down the ruthless Armando Armas, the vicious leader of a Miami drug cartel.

analysis.summary: While the movie captures some of the charm of the original films and delivers enjoyable action sequences, it falls short with weak characters, a safe narrative, and a lackluster soundtrack. Despite its flaws, it's still a decent watch for fans of the franchise or action movies in general, providing about two hours of entertainment.

metadata.overview: At the height of the First World War, two young British soldiers must cross enemy territory and deliver a message that will stop a deadly attack on hundreds of soldiers.

analysis.summary: The movie is a technical marvel with impressive cinematography and incredible performances from the leads, creating a tense and immersive experience. While there are a few cliches and slow scenes that feel out of place, the overall execution, disturbing visuals, and unique approach to the war narrative make it a highly enjoyable and cinematic masterpiece.

metadata.name: Vinland Saga
metadata.overview: For a thousand years, the Vikings have made quite a name and reputation for themselves as the strongest families with a thirst for violence. Thorfinn, the son of one of the Vikings' greatest warriors, spends his boyhood in a battlefield enhancing his skills in his adventure to redeem his most-desired revenge after his father was murdered.

analysis.summary: Vinland Saga is an Amazon exclusive anime that impresses with its well-written story, strong character development, and top-notch animation. While some viewers may find certain historical aspects and slow-paced episodes less engaging, the show offers a compelling narrative with memorable characters and intense action scenes, making it a highly recommended watch.

metadata.name: The Mandalorian
metadata.overview: After the fall of the Galactic Empire, lawlessness has spread throughout the galaxy. A lone gunfighter makes his way through the outer reaches, earning his keep as a bounty hunter.

analysis.summary: The Mandalorian delivers a thrilling and enjoyable experience with well-developed characters, exciting action sequences, and engaging storytelling. While two episodes in the middle falter, the series as a whole shines with its exploration of different environments, compelling relationships, and promising future for the Star Wars franchise.

videos.title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker

metadata.title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker
metadata.original_title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker
metadata.overview: The surviving Resistance faces the First Order once again as the journey of Rey, Finn and Poe Dameron continues. With the power and knowledge of generations behind them, the final battle begins.

analysis.summary: While the movie has strong music and some moments of nostalgia, it falls short with a convoluted plot, careless handling of important details, and disappointing character development. Despite the talented cast, the overall execution is lacking, resulting in a disappointing conclusion to the saga.

metadata.name: Dr. STONE
metadata.overview: One fateful day, all of humanity was petrified by a blinding flash of light. After several millennia, high schooler Taiju awakens and finds himself lost in a world of statues. However, he's not alone! His science-loving friend Senku's been up and running for a few months and he's got a grand plan in mind, to kickstart civilization with the power of science!

analysis.summary: The TV series impressively blends science education with entertaining storytelling, showcasing accurate scientific processes and engaging character development. While some pacing issues arise towards the end, the overall experience is unique, educational, and thoroughly enjoyable, making it a standout anime of the year.

metadata.title: Knives Out
metadata.overview: When renowned crime novelist Harlan Thrombey is found dead at his estate just after his 85th birthday, the inquisitive and debonair Detective Benoit Blanc is mysteriously enlisted to investigate. From Harlan's dysfunctional family to his devoted staff, Blanc sifts through a web of red herrings and self-serving lies to uncover the truth behind Harlan's untimely death.

metadata.title: A Frozen Christmas 2
metadata.overview: When Santa and his reindeer pal Barnaby finish delivering presents for Christmas, they head back to the North Pole to celebrate. Gather around and listen as Santa and his elf pals dance and tell stories. Including time-honored Christmas story classics!

analysis.summary: While the movie boasts beautiful animation and a few standout musical numbers, it lacks the soul and impact of its predecessor, feeling more like a cash grab than a passion project. The story's low stakes and underwhelming resolutions, along with reduced roles for some characters, contribute to a somewhat disappointing experience overall.

metadata.description: As with Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire, a demo version of Pokémon Sun and Moon versions was distributed on the Nintendo eShop one month prior to the full release.
metadata.title: Pokémon Sun and Pokémon Moon: Special Demo Version

analysis.summary: While the gameplay loop remains satisfying, the game suffers from objective flaws, including dysfunctional online features and a lack of meaningful innovation. Despite some visually appealing elements and a few well-designed new Pokemon, the overall experience feels like a step back in terms of content and value, failing to justify its existence as a new entry in the franchise.

metadata.description: This Deluxe Edition contains:
metadata.title: Star Wars: Jedi - Fallen Order: Deluxe Edition

analysis.summary: The gameplay offers enjoyable combat mechanics with a variety of force powers and satisfying one-on-one fights, complemented by well-designed puzzles and map layouts. Despite some clunkiness in animations, platforming, and camera control, the game's engaging story set in a fascinating time period of the Star Wars universe makes it a joy to play for both fans and newcomers alike.

metadata.description: This special release of Death Stranding game comes with a DLC voucher that adds four bonus items that are not available as standalone DLCs. In US these extras are part of any pre-order release of the game, while in Japan this was a regular launch release where extras were included as an early purchase bonus.
metadata.title: Death Stranding
Parasite
metadata.overview: Paul Dean has created a deadly parasite that is now attached to his stomach. He and his female companion, Patricia Welles, must find a way to destroy it while also trying to avoid Ricus, his rednecks, and an evil government agent named Merchant.

metadata.description: This is a compilation of Premier Manager 3 and its Premier Multi-Edit System. PM3 has been updated to 1995-1996 season data, with promoted and relegated teams moved divisions and player transfers activated - this means that previous saved games aren't compatible.
metadata.title: Premier Manager 3 De-Luxe

analysis.summary: Luigi's Mansion 3 offers a nostalgic and enjoyable experience with its unique hotel setting, diverse boss battles, and cleverly designed puzzles. While occasional frustrating controls and camera angles detract from the experience, the overall game is a must-have for Switch owners, providing a cute and exciting adventure that is both fun and engaging.

metadata.title: Terminator: Dark Fate
metadata.overview: Decades after Sarah Connor prevented Judgment Day, a lethal new Terminator is sent to eliminate the future leader of the resistance. In a fight to save mankind, battle-hardened Sarah Connor teams up with an unexpected ally and an enhanced super soldier to stop the deadliest Terminator yet.

analysis.summary: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the latest Terminator movie, which effectively disregards everything after Terminator 2 and delivers a solid plot with enjoyable characters and impressive action scenes. Despite occasional goofiness and some issues with CGI, the overall film is a refreshing addition to the franchise, leaving me optimistic for its future.

metadata.description: This is a parody remake of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2. All the main scenes (including the notorious "No Russian" level) from the 3D shooter are remade in hand-drawn 2D. The levels, however, are very short, each of them lasting a few brief minutes.
metadata.title: Modern Warfare 2D
Maleficent: Mistress of Evil
metadata.overview: Maleficent and her goddaughter Aurora begin to question the complex family ties that bind them as they are pulled in different directions by impending nuptials, unexpected allies, and dark new forces at play.

analysis.summary: I found the movie to be visually pleasing with a unique twist on a classic tale, despite its weaker storyline compared to the first installment. While lacking Angelina Jolie's presence at times, the film still offers an engaging narrative and impressive visuals, making it an enjoyable addition to the Disney universe.

metadata.title: Zombieland: Double Tap
metadata.overview: Columbus, Tallahassee, Wichita, and Little Rock move to the American heartland as they face off against evolved zombies, fellow survivors, and the growing pains of the snarky makeshift family.

analysis.summary: While the movie retains some of the charm and style of the original, it falls short in delivering effective comedy and feels dated in its humor. Despite this, the visuals and character dynamics still make it worth a watch for fans of the first installment.

metadata.name: Gemini Man
metadata.overview: Sam Casey is an agent for INTERSECT, a government think-tank and operations center specializing in secret missions. While on a diving assignment, Sam was affected by the radiation from an underwater explosion. The radiation rendered him invisible, but INTERSECT devised a way to control his invisibility, by fitting him with a computerized watch that kept him visible. He could, however, shut it off, and become invisible again, for short periods of time. If he did this for more than 15 minutes in any 24 hour period he would die. This ability to become invisible made him a very effective agent.

metadata.title: Joker
metadata.overview: During the 1980s, a failed stand-up comedian is driven insane and turns to a life of crime and chaos in Gotham City while becoming an infamous psychopathic crime figure.

analysis.summary: I thoroughly enjoyed the movie, particularly Joaquin Phoenix's portrayal of the character and the impactful score. However, some scenes felt unnecessarily bizarre, though they didn't detract significantly from the overall experience. Overall, it's a compelling character piece with intense moments and a thought-provoking narrative.

metadata.description: The Deluxe Edition of the 2019 game Code Vein includes:* Code Vein (base game)
metadata.title: Code Vein (Deluxe Edition)

analysis.summary: I enjoyed experimenting with character builds and appreciated the depth offered by the blood codes and abilities system. However, the lack of combat depth, particularly in boss fights, and the repetition of enemies throughout the game were significant drawbacks. Despite its flaws, I found the game's story and soundtrack engaging, making it an overall enjoyable experience.

metadata.title: Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba -To the Hashira Training-
metadata.original_title: 「鬼滅の刃」絆の奇跡、そして柱稽古へ
metadata.overview: A compilation film featuring the eleventh episode of the Swordsmith Village Arc and the first episode of the Hashira Training Arc.

analysis.summary: I enjoyed the satisfying gameplay mechanics, particularly the improved enemy placement and diverse weapon options. However, the confusing map design and lackluster narrative detracted from the overall experience. Despite its flaws, it's a game I appreciate for its passion and fun gameplay.

metadata.title: Rambo: Last Blood
metadata.overview: After fighting his demons for decades, John Rambo now lives in peace on his family ranch in Arizona, but his rest is interrupted when Gabriela, the granddaughter of his housekeeper María, disappears after crossing the border into Mexico to meet her biological father. Rambo, who has become a true father figure for Gabriela over the years, undertakes a desperate and dangerous journey to find her.

analysis.summary: The movie had enjoyable ultraviolent gore scenes and a satisfying revenge plot, but suffered from disjointed pacing and inconsistencies in character development. Despite its flaws, it provided a decently entertaining experience, especially for fans of the action genre.

metadata.description: This retail version of Borderlands contains:
metadata.title: Borderlands 3

analysis.summary: While the game offers enjoyable gameplay and a plethora of weapons, the writing and humor were largely disliked by the reviewer, leading to tedious dialogue and quest design. Despite these drawbacks, the gameplay and variety of weapons contributed to an overall positive experience.

metadata.title: It Chapter Two
metadata.overview: 27 years after overcoming the malevolent supernatural entity Pennywise, the former members of the Losers' Club, who have grown up and moved away from Derry, are brought back together by a devastating phone call.

analysis.summary: While the movie offers enjoyable character-driven storytelling and maintains brutality, the reviewer finds the horror elements lacking in tension and the CGI sometimes goofy. However, the comedy lands well, and despite some issues with the final showdown, it's a solid horror flick with a long but justified runtime.

metadata.name: Ready or Not
metadata.overview: Ready or Not is a Canadian teen drama series which aired on the Showtime Movie Channel and later on the Disney Channel and Global Television Network for 5 seasons and 65 episodes between 1993 and 1997 in both Canada and the United States.

analysis.summary: The movie excels in delivering dark humor and tense situations, with strong performances and a self-aware approach to its silliness. While some jokes may overstay their welcome and tension varies, it offers an enjoyable and entertaining experience overall, though not particularly scary.

The game offers enjoyable gameplay with procedurally generated content and deep customization options, although it suffers from stiff controls and occasional hit detection issues. While the narrative and voice acting may feel lacking, it's still a fun experience, especially with friends, offering good value for its price.

metadata.title: Invader Zim: Enter the Florpus
metadata.overview: ZIM discovers his almighty leaders never had any intention of coming to Earth and he loses confidence in himself for the first time in his life, which is the big break his human nemesis, Dib has been waiting for.

metadata.title: The Angry Birds Movie 2
metadata.overview: Red, Chuck, Bomb and the rest of their feathered friends are surprised when a green pig suggests that they put aside their differences and unite to fight a common threat. Aggressive birds from an island covered in ice are planning to use an elaborate weapon to destroy the fowl and swine.

videos.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark

metadata.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark
metadata.original_title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark
metadata.overview: Mill Valley, Pennsylvania, Halloween night, 1968. After playing a joke on a school bully, Stella and her friends decide to sneak into a supposedly haunted house that once belonged to the powerful Bellows family, unleashing dark forces that they will be unable to control.

videos.title: Dora and the Lost City of Gold

metadata.title: Dora and the Lost City of Gold
metadata.original_title: Dora and the Lost City of Gold
metadata.overview: Dora, a girl who has spent most of her life exploring the jungle with her parents, now must navigate her most dangerous adventure yet: high school. Always the explorer, Dora quickly finds herself leading Boots (her best friend, a monkey), Diego, and a rag tag group of teens on an adventure to save her parents and solve the impossible mystery behind a lost Inca civilization.

analysis.summary: While the movie is serviceable for children and has moments that might entertain them, as an adult viewer, it can be embarrassing and lacks appeal. The actress playing the main character does a great job, but overall, it's not enjoyable for adults and relies heavily on nostalgia for the source material.

metadata.title: Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw
metadata.overview: Ever since US Diplomatic Security Service Agent Hobbs and lawless outcast Shaw first faced off, they just have traded smack talk and body blows. But when cyber-genetically enhanced anarchist Brixton's ruthless actions threaten the future of humanity, they join forces to defeat him.

analysis.summary: The movie delivers exactly what's expected: stupid, over-the-top fun with lots of action. While the banter between the main characters can be grating and some scenes feel lazy, it's an enjoyable use of time and sets up potential for future installments in the franchise.

metadata.name: The Boys
metadata.overview: A group of vigilantes known informally as “The Boys” set out to take down corrupt superheroes with no more than blue-collar grit and a willingness to fight dirty.

analysis.summary: The show offers a realistic take on superheroes, portraying them as flawed and corrupt individuals, which is executed exceptionally well. While some dialogue and character decisions may miss the mark occasionally, it's visually impressive, entertaining, and handles dark themes effectively.

videos.title: Once Upon A Time In Hollywood

metadata.title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood
metadata.original_title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood
metadata.overview: Los Angeles, 1969. TV star Rick Dalton, a struggling actor specializing in westerns, and stuntman Cliff Booth, his best friend, try to survive in a constantly changing movie industry. Dalton is the neighbor of the young and promising actress and model Sharon Tate, who has just married the prestigious Polish director Roman Polanski…

analysis.summary: While the last 15 minutes offer spectacular entertainment, the rest of the movie lacks conflict, tension, and effective comedy. Characters, including a prominent one portrayed by Margot Robbie, contribute little to the narrative, resulting in a disappointing and tedious three-hour experience.

metadata.title: The Lion King
metadata.overview: A young lion prince is cast out of his pride by his cruel uncle, who claims he killed his father. While the uncle rules with an iron paw, the prince grows up beyond the Savannah, living by a philosophy: No worries for the rest of your days. But when his past comes to haunt him, the young prince must decide his fate: Will he remain an outcast or face his demons and become what he needs to be?

analysis.summary: While the visuals are stunning and the voice cast performs well, the film lacks the emotion and personality of the original due to its hyper-realistic animation style. It feels like a passionless cash-grab, offering little in terms of innovation or improvement over the beloved original.

metadata.title: Crawl
metadata.overview: When a huge hurricane hits her hometown in Florida, Haley ignores evacuation orders to look for her father. After finding him badly wounded, both are trapped by the flood. With virtually no time to escape the storm, they discover that rising water levels are the least of their problems.

metadata.name: One-Punch Man
metadata.overview: Saitama is a hero who only became a hero for fun. After three years of “special” training, though, he’s become so strong that he’s practically invincible. In fact, he’s too strong — even his mightiest opponents are taken out with a single punch, and it turns out that being devastatingly powerful is actually kind of a bore. With his passion for being a hero lost along with his hair, yet still faced with new enemies every day, how much longer can he keep it going?

metadata.name: Stranger Things
metadata.overview: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl.

analysis.summary: Season 3 of the show is praised for its strong character development, particularly with Billy, and its increase in violence, which adds depth to the villain. However, there are complaints about certain plot points, like the discovery of the Russian base, underutilization of characters like Will, and unresolved storylines, such as the subplot with the rats and poison. Overall, the reviewer finds the season enjoyable and rates both Season 3 and the show as a whole at 90%.

metadata.title: Midsommar
metadata.overview: Several friends travel to Sweden to study as anthropologists a summer festival that is held every ninety years in the remote hometown of one of them. What begins as a dream vacation in a place where the sun never sets, gradually turns into a dark nightmare as the mysterious inhabitants invite them to participate in their disturbing festive activities.

metadata.title: Spider-Man: Far From Home
metadata.overview: Peter Parker and his friends go on a summer trip to Europe. However, they will hardly be able to rest - Peter will have to agree to help Nick Fury uncover the mystery of creatures that cause natural disasters and destruction throughout the continent.

metadata.title: Annabelle Comes Home
metadata.overview: Determined to keep Annabelle from wreaking more havoc, demonologists Ed and Lorraine Warren bring the possessed doll to the locked artifacts room in their home, placing her “safely” behind sacred glass and enlisting a priest’s holy blessing. But an unholy night of horror awaits as Annabelle awakens the evil spirits in the room, who all set their sights on a new target—the Warrens' ten-year-old daughter, Judy, and her friends.

analysis.summary: Annabelle Comes Home offers standard horror fare with enjoyable characters and a fun premise, but suffers from nonsensical plot elements and lackluster tension-building. Despite its flaws, it provides a decently average viewing experience with some entertaining moments.

metadata.name: Child's Play
metadata.overview: Child's Play was a British game show based on a U.S. format of the same name. It aired on ITV from 7 January 1984 to 26 August 1988 and was hosted by Michael Aspel.

analysis.summary: Child's Play delivers a fun and creative take on the classic Chucky concept, with enjoyable dark humor, creative kills, and solid performances. While the ending feels a bit anticlimactic and some elements are overly goofy, it's overall a satisfying slasher movie experience that justifies its existence.

metadata.title: Toy Story 4
metadata.overview: Woody has always been confident about his place in the world and that his priority is taking care of his kid, whether that's Andy or Bonnie. But when Bonnie adds a reluctant new toy called "Forky" to her room, a road trip adventure alongside old and new friends will show Woody how big the world can be for a toy.

analysis.summary: Toy Story 4 exceeded my expectations with its outstanding comedy, visually breathtaking animation, and strong new characters like Forky. While it may not add significantly to the existing characters, it provides a satisfying conclusion to the franchise with emotional moments and a well-rounded story, despite a slightly rushed ending.

metadata.title: Men in Black: International
metadata.overview: The Men in Black have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. In this new adventure, they tackle their biggest, most global threat to date: a mole in the Men in Black organization.

analysis.summary: While the chemistry between the lead actors is commendable, the movie suffers from poor writing, bad comedy, and lackluster action sequences. Despite attempts to capture the essence of the franchise, it falls short in every department, making it a disappointing addition to the series.

metadata.title: Dark Phoenix
metadata.overview: The X-Men face their most formidable and powerful foe when one of their own, Jean Grey, starts to spiral out of control. During a rescue mission in outer space, Jean is nearly killed when she's hit by a mysterious cosmic force. Once she returns home, this force not only makes her infinitely more powerful, but far more unstable. The X-Men must now band together to save her soul and battle aliens that want to use Grey's new abilities to rule the galaxy.

metadata.name: The Third Marriage
metadata.overview: Love and marriage bloom in a game of truth with a woman who lives a fake life and a woman who tries to reveal it.

analysis.summary: While Octavia Spencer's performance stands out, the movie fails to deliver as either a horror film or a character-focused drama due to poor writing and nonsensical character decisions. Despite attempts at humor, the movie falls flat and lacks any genuine scares or tension, resulting in a boring and disappointing experience overall.

metadata.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
metadata.overview: Follows the heroic efforts of the crypto-zoological agency Monarch as its members face off against a battery of god-sized monsters, including the mighty Godzilla, who collides with Mothra, Rodan, and his ultimate nemesis, the three-headed King Ghidorah. When these ancient super-species, thought to be mere myths, rise again, they all vie for supremacy, leaving humanity's very existence hanging in the balance.

analysis.summary: While the visuals are impressive at times, the excessive use of flashing lights and jump cuts make certain scenes painful to watch, overshadowing the enjoyment of the monster fights. Poor character development and plot holes detract from the overall experience, leaving the movie lacking in substance and coherence.

metadata.title: Brightburn
metadata.overview: What if a child from another world crash-landed on Earth, but instead of becoming a hero to mankind, he proved to be something far more sinister?

metadata.name: Aladdin
metadata.overview: Aladdin is an animated television series made by Walt Disney Television which aired from 1994 to 1995, based on the original 1992 feature. It was animated at the Slightly Offbeat Productions Studios in Penrose, Auckland, New Zealand. Coming on the heels of the direct-to-video sequel The Return of Jafar, the series picked up where that installment left off, with Aladdin now living in the palace, engaged to beautiful and spunky Princess Jasmine. "Al" and Jasmine went together into peril among sorcerers, monsters, thieves, and more. Monkey sidekick Abu, the animated Magic Carpet, and the fast-talking, shape-shifting Genie came along to help, as did sassy, complaining parrot Iago, formerly Jafar’s pet but now an antihero. Jafar, having previously been destroyed in the second movie, returns in only one episode which also serves as a crossover with Hercules: The Animated Series.

analysis.summary: While the live-action adaptation of the classic falls short of the original's energy and enthusiasm, it manages to deliver some decent moments, particularly with Will Smith's portrayal of the genie. However, weak dialogue and uninspired scenes detract from the overall experience, leaving the film feeling unnecessary and inferior to its animated counterpart.

metadata.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum
metadata.overview: Super-assassin John Wick returns with a $14 million price tag on his head and an army of bounty-hunting killers on his trail. After killing a member of the shadowy international assassin’s guild, the High Table, John Wick is excommunicado, but the world’s most ruthless hit men and women await his every turn.

metadata.title: Pokémon Detective Pikachu
metadata.overview: In a world where people collect pocket-size monsters (Pokémon) to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent monster who seeks to be a detective.

metadata.title: Avengers: Endgame
metadata.overview: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War, the universe is in ruins due to the efforts of the Mad Titan, Thanos. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers must assemble once more in order to undo Thanos' actions and restore order to the universe once and for all, no matter what consequences may be in store.

analysis.summary: The game offers strategic gameplay with a focus on timing and tactics, enhanced by an incredibly comprehensive tutorial. However, the overwhelmingly greedy microtransaction system, particularly in the challenge towers, tarnishes the overall experience, making progression feel unfairly obstructed and discouraging.

metadata.title: Game of Thrones The IMAX Experience
metadata.original_title: Game of Thrones The IMAX Experience
metadata.overview: The first episode of this IMAX screening takes place entirely at The Wall with the Night’s Watch (S4 EP9) hopelessly outnumbered as they attempt to defend Castle Black from the Wildings and features one the fiercest and most intense battle scenes ever filmed for television. The second episode (S4 EP10), features Dany coming to grips with the realities of ruling a kingdom, Bran learning the startling reality of his destiny and Tyrion facing the truth of his unfortunate situation.

metadata.title: The Curse of La Llorona
metadata.overview: In 1970s Los Angeles, ignoring the eerie warning of a troubled mother suspected of child endangerment, a social worker and her own young kids are soon drawn into a frightening supernatural realm.

metadata.title: Game of Thrones The IMAX Experience
metadata.original_title: Game of Thrones The IMAX Experience
metadata.overview: The first episode of this IMAX screening takes place entirely at The Wall with the Night’s Watch (S4 EP9) hopelessly outnumbered as they attempt to defend Castle Black from the Wildings and features one the fiercest and most intense battle scenes ever filmed for television. The second episode (S4 EP10), features Dany coming to grips with the realities of ruling a kingdom, Bran learning the startling reality of his destiny and Tyrion facing the truth of his unfortunate situation.

analysis.summary: Season 1 of the series establishes a gripping storyline with superb character development and strong performances, despite occasional limitations in battle scenes. While the overload of characters and occasional budget constraints are noticeable, the intricate storytelling, rich world-building, and captivating dialogue make it a highly enjoyable season overall, earning a solid rating on the moist meter.

metadata.name: Mob Psycho 100
metadata.overview: Shigeo Kageyama, a.k.a. "Mob," is a boy who has trouble expressing himself, but who happens to be a powerful esper. Mob is determined to live a normal life and keeps his ESP suppressed, but when his emotions surge to a level of 100%, something terrible happens to him! As he's surrounded by false espers, evil spirits, and mysterious organizations, what will Mob think? What choices will he make?

metadata.title: Hellboy
metadata.overview: In the final days of World War II, the Nazis attempt to use black magic to aid their dying cause. The Allies raid the camp where the ceremony is taking place, but not before they summon a baby demon who is rescued by Allied forces and dubbed "Hellboy". Sixty years later, Hellboy serves the cause of good rather than evil as an agent in the Bureau of Paranormal Research & Defense, along with Abe Sapien - a merman with psychic powers, and Liz Sherman - a woman with pyrokinesis, protecting America against dark forces.

metadata.title: Pet Sematary
metadata.overview: Dr. Louis Creed and his wife, Rachel, move from Boston to Ludlow, in rural Maine, with their two young children. Hidden in the woods near the new family home, Ellie, their eldest daughter, discovers a mysterious cemetery where the pets of community members are buried.

analysis.summary: I found some scenes effectively built suspense, although the overall movie felt generic with predictable jump scares. The pacing and dark tone were strengths, but the constant presence of trucks on a nearby road became distracting and detracted from the experience. While it's not exceptional, it's an above-average horror movie with decent acting and some effective gore.

metadata.title: Shazam!
metadata.overview: A boy is given the ability to become an adult superhero in times of need with a single magic word.

analysis.summary: While the CGI and action sequences were lacking, the movie excelled in delivering a heartfelt and wholesome family comedy with a strong cast and engaging character dynamics. The weak villain and poorly executed action scenes were notable drawbacks, but the film's self-awareness and light-hearted tone made it an enjoyable experience overall.

metadata.description: The Director's Cut is a remake of the original Broken Sword game. The game features the same basic story, but has additional locales to visit, more puzzles and tells parts of the story from Nico's perspective. Some of the puzzles also make use of the unique abilities of Nintendo's game consoles and the animated facial expressions have been redrawn by Dave Gibbons.
metadata.title: Broken Sword: Shadow of the Templars - The Director's Cut

analysis.summary: While the game provides numerous idols and a forgiving death mechanic, the camera issues and questionable difficulty spikes detract from the experience. Additionally, some prosthetic attachments and skill trees feel underutilized, but overall, the game is praised for its spectacular gameplay and challenging final boss.

metadata.description: Devil May Cry 5: Deluxe Edition is a compilation of:
metadata.title: Devil May Cry 5: Deluxe Edition

analysis.summary: While the game excels in smooth gameplay mechanics and visually stunning set pieces, the poorly written dialogue and weak narrative are significant drawbacks. Despite these flaws, the game delivers an enjoyable hack-and-slash experience with memorable characters and challenging gameplay, earning it a solid recommendation.

metadata.title: Captain Marvel
metadata.overview: The story follows Carol Danvers as she becomes one of the universe’s most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races. Set in the 1990s, Captain Marvel is an all-new adventure from a previously unseen period in the history of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

analysis.summary: While the main character lacks depth and the plot is highly predictable, there are some enjoyable moments, particularly in the interactions between certain characters. However, the poorly executed action scenes, predictable story, and forgettable narrative make it fall short of being a standout Marvel movie.

metadata.description: Anthem is a shared-world action RPG. Players take on the role of a Freelancer, a member of a group of pilots who wear powerful exosuits called Javelins, to explore a large and dangerous world. The game is set in a lush and dynamic world called Bastion, which is filled with danger, mysteries and ancient ruins.
metadata.title: Anthem

analysis.summary: The game suffers from numerous flaws including uninspired mission design, repetitive gameplay, lack of variety in loot, and frequent bugs and disconnections. Despite some occasionally nice visuals and a decent soundtrack, the overall lack of passion and talent in its development makes it an unenjoyable experience.

metadata.title: Happy Death Day 2U
metadata.overview: Collegian Tree Gelbman wakes up in horror to learn that she's stuck in a parallel universe. Her boyfriend Carter is now with someone else, and her friends and fellow students seem to be completely different versions of themselves. When Tree discovers that Carter's roommate has been altering time, she finds herself once again the target of a masked killer. When the psychopath starts to go after her inner circle, Tree soon realizes that she must die over and over again to save everyone.

analysis.summary: While the movie does well with comedy and emotional moments, it falls short compared to its predecessor due to a shift away from horror elements and a less engaging plot. Jessica Roth's performance carries the film, but the lack of mystery and generic slasher tropes make it a letdown for fans of the original.

metadata.title: Alita: Battle Angel
metadata.overview: When Alita awakens with no memory of who she is in a future world she does not recognize, she is taken in by Ido, a compassionate doctor who realizes that somewhere in this abandoned cyborg shell is the heart and soul of a young woman with an extraordinary past.

analysis.summary: Despite some flaws in acting, character design, and story cliches, the film impresses with stunning visuals, exhilarating action choreography, and engaging world-building. It offers a unique blend of anime-inspired elements and early '90s extreme vibes, making it a highly entertaining and visually spectacular experience.

metadata.title: The Prodigy
metadata.overview: A mother concerned about her young son's disturbing behavior thinks something supernatural may be affecting him.

analysis.summary: While the film presents an intriguing premise and effectively builds tension in the first half, it ultimately succumbs to generic horror tropes and a disappointing second half. Despite solid performances and occasional well-executed scares, the reliance on cliches and a lackluster ending undermine its potential.

metadata.title: The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part
metadata.original_title: The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part
metadata.overview: It's been five years since everything was awesome and the citizens are facing a huge new threat: LEGO DUPLO® invaders from outer space, wrecking everything faster than they can rebuild.

metadata.description: Apex Legends is a battle royale, first-person shooter spin-off of the Titanfall series, developed by Respawn Entertainment. The game is set in a gritty sci-fi world, centered around the in-lore event, the Apex Games, where combatants fight for glory and wealth using an arsenal of weapons, as well as their own tools and abilities.
metadata.title: Apex Legends

analysis.summary: Despite initial skepticism, the game's mechanics and depth grew on me over time, with tight gunplay and class-based abilities adding variety to matches. However, some weapons and classes are underpowered, and server stability issues detract from the overall experience, though innovative features like the pinging system and respawn mechanic elevate it above other battle royale games.

metadata.description: This compilation includes:
metadata.title: Kingdom Hearts III

metadata.description: Contemplation is the second episode of Resident Evil: Revelations 2, a survival horror game initially released as four downloadable episodes with a weekly release, and then also as single game and in retail. This second episode is released as DLC for the first one and the story continues from the events of the first episode.
metadata.title: Resident Evil: Revelations 2 - Episode 2: Contemplation

analysis.summary: The game's ground-up remake captured the essence of the original while delivering a fresh and visually stunning experience, though some puzzles were criticized for their tedious scavenger hunt-style solutions. Despite bullet sponge zombies and repetitive playthroughs, the game's tense atmosphere, old-school level design, and thrilling gameplay made it an enjoyable and memorable experience overall.

metadata.title: Dragon Ball Z: Broly – The Legendary Super Saiyan
metadata.original_title: ドラゴンボールＺ 燃え尽きろ!!熱戦・烈戦・超激戦
metadata.overview: While the Saiyan Paragus persuades Vegeta to rule a new planet, King Kai alerts Goku of the South Galaxy's destruction by an unknown Super Saiyan.

metadata.title: Glass
metadata.overview: In a series of escalating encounters, former security guard David Dunn uses his supernatural abilities to track Kevin Wendell Crumb, a disturbed man who has twenty-four personalities. Meanwhile, the shadowy presence of Elijah Price emerges as an orchestrator who holds secrets critical to both men.

analysis.summary: While the movie starts strong with compelling characters and an intriguing setup, it ultimately falls short due to an underwhelming ending and numerous plot holes. Despite enjoying the buildup, the lack of payoff and lazy cop-outs in the final act left me disappointed overall.

metadata.title: Replicas
metadata.overview: A scientist becomes obsessed with returning his family to normalcy after a terrible accident.

analysis.summary: While the movie had a promising concept, its execution was abysmal with terrible dialogue, performances, and CGI. Despite my love for Keanu Reeves, this movie was a disappointment on every level, earning its place as one of the worst of 2019.

metadata.title: Escape Room
metadata.overview: Six strangers find themselves in circumstances beyond their control, and must use their wits to survive.

metadata.title: Bird Box
metadata.overview: Five years after an ominous unseen presence drives most of society to suicide, a survivor and her two children make a desperate bid to reach safety.

metadata.title: Black Mirror: Bandersnatch
metadata.overview: In 1984, a young programmer begins to question reality as he adapts a dark fantasy novel into a video game. A mind-bending tale with multiple endings.

analysis.summary: I thoroughly enjoyed the interactive storytelling and the way choices were integrated into the narrative seamlessly. The characters were well-developed and there were plenty of Easter eggs to discover. While some choice outcomes were a bit goofy, overall, it was a fantastic and unique experience that I highly recommend.

metadata.name: Goblin Slayer
metadata.overview:
"I'm not saving the world. I just kill goblins."

Rumor has it that, in a certain guild in the middle of nowhere, there is an extraordinary man who has climbed all the way to the Silver rank just by killing goblins. At the same guild, a priestess who's just become a new adventurer has formed her first party... and the man who ends up rescuing that party when they get into trouble is none other than the Goblin Slayer.

analysis.summary: While the first episode sets a promising tone, the rest of the series falls short with lackluster episodes and forgettable characters, except for the main protagonist. Although there are some redeeming qualities, such as the humanization of the main character and the absence of heavy CGI in later episodes, the overall experience doesn't live up to the initial excitement.

This comedy film falls flat with poorly executed jokes and forced modern references. While John C. Reilly's performance offers some slight redemption, overall, it's a disappointing and forgettable movie experience.

metadata.title: Bumblebee
metadata.overview: On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small Californian beach town. Charlie, on the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.  When Charlie revives him, she quickly learns this is no ordinary yellow VW bug.

analysis.summary: While the CGI and action choreography are an improvement from previous Transformers films, the overall movie suffers from weak dialogue, generic characters, and forced humor. Despite its flaws, it offers a heartwarming story and is a step in the right direction for the franchise.

metadata.title: Aquaman
metadata.overview: Half-human, half-Atlantean Arthur Curry is taken on the journey of his lifetime to discover if he is worth of being a king.

metadata.description: Smash Hits!: Ultimate Pop Quiz is a DVD game for one to four players. The format of the game is loosely based on an awards ceremony with players receiving awards. The single player consists of twenty questions, worth one or two points, and is over either when all questions have been asked or when twenty points have been scored. The multiplayer game ends when twenty points have been scored. The game is fully voiced at 'menu level' - in other words it uses standard phrases such as 'Your turn player one', 'Choose a question type from the following options', 'You've chosen Love Songs - How romantic' and suchlike but all the questions are text that must be read.
metadata.title: Smash Hits!: Ultimate Pop Quiz

analysis.summary: Smash Bros Ultimate offers a balanced roster with enjoyable gameplay and a deep adventure mode. However, its online multiplayer is severely lacking and holds back an otherwise flawless experience.

metadata.title: Mortal Engines
metadata.overview: Many thousands of years in the future, Earth’s cities roam the globe on huge wheels, devouring each other in a struggle for ever diminishing resources. On one of these massive traction cities, the old London, Tom Natsworthy has an unexpected encounter with a mysterious young woman from the wastelands who will change the course of his life forever.

metadata.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
metadata.overview: Struggling to find his place in the world while juggling school and family, Brooklyn teenager Miles Morales is unexpectedly bitten by a radioactive spider and develops unfathomable powers just like the one and only Spider-Man. While wrestling with the implications of his new abilities, Miles discovers a super collider created by the madman Wilson "Kingpin" Fisk, causing others from across the Spider-Verse to be inadvertently transported to his dimension.

analysis.summary: The animation is stunning, the characters are well-written, and the story is heartwarming, making it one of the best superhero movies and possibly the best animated movie ever made. Despite a weak villain motivation, the film excels in all other aspects, delivering an incredible cinematic experience.

metadata.description: Darksiders III is an action role-playing game in which the player returns to an apocalyptic Earth assuming the role of Fury, one of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse, in her quest to hunt down and dispose of the Seven Deadly Sins. From a behind view, she fights enemies using her whip and Hollow weapons acquired throughout the game.
metadata.title: Darksiders III

analysis.summary: While the game has undeniable charm and a labor of love from the development team, it suffers from rushed gameplay, clunky mechanics, and a disjointed story due to low budget and time constraints. Despite these flaws, it offers enjoyable moments, well-designed puzzles, and potential for future installments with improvements.

metadata.name: Robin Hood's Big Adventure
metadata.original_name: ロビンフッドの大冒険
metadata.overview: Robin Hood's Big Adventure is an anime adaptation of the classic Robin Hood story consisting of 52 episodes. In this version, Robin and his allies are mostly pre-teens.

metadata.title: Ralph Breaks the Internet
metadata.overview: Video game bad guy Ralph and fellow misfit Vanellope von Schweetz must risk it all by traveling to the World Wide Web in search of a replacement part to save Vanellope's video game, Sugar Rush. In way over their heads, Ralph and Vanellope rely on the citizens of the internet — the netizens — to help navigate their way, including an entrepreneur named Yesss, who is the head algorithm and the heart and soul of trend-making site BuzzzTube.

analysis.summary: While the movie has some cool scenes and great animation, it feels like a soulless cash grab with forced internet culture references and excessive Disney product placement. Despite its disappointing execution, it's not a bad movie overall, but it lacks the heart and charm of the original.

metadata.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald
metadata.original_title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald
metadata.overview: Gellert Grindelwald has escaped imprisonment and has begun gathering followers to his cause—elevating wizards above all non-magical beings. The only one capable of putting a stop to him is the wizard he once called his closest friend, Albus Dumbledore. However, Dumbledore will need to seek help from the wizard who had thwarted Grindelwald once before, his former student Newt Scamander, who agrees to help, unaware of the dangers that lie ahead. Lines are drawn as love and loyalty are tested, even among the truest friends and family, in an increasingly divided wizarding world.

analysis.summary: While the movie has some good visuals and characters, it suffers from a poorly constructed plot, confusing narrative, and questionable additions to the Wizarding World lore. Despite enjoying certain elements, the overall disappointment stems from the lackluster execution and triviality of the storyline.

metadata.title: Overlord
metadata.overview: France, June 1944. On the eve of D-Day, some American paratroopers fall behind enemy lines after their aircraft crashes while on a mission to destroy a radio tower in a small village near the beaches of Normandy. After reaching their target, the surviving paratroopers realise that, in addition to fighting the Nazi troops that patrol the village, they also must fight against something else.

analysis.summary: While the movie didn't deliver on the promises of the trailers, it still provided entertaining action and visuals, especially in the first and final acts. However, the narrative was generic and formulaic, with underdeveloped characters and a lack of depth to the story, despite the presence of intriguing monster elements.

metadata.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
metadata.overview: Singer Freddie Mercury, guitarist Brian May, drummer Roger Taylor and bass guitarist John Deacon take the music world by storm when they form the rock 'n' roll band Queen in 1970. Hit songs become instant classics. When Mercury's increasingly wild lifestyle starts to spiral out of control, Queen soon faces its greatest challenge yet – finding a way to keep the band together amid the success and excess.

analysis.summary: While the performances, especially by Rami Malek, were commendable, the film's disjointed narrative and lack of commitment to exploring Queen's story or Freddie Mercury's personal life made it feel shallow and generic. The movie relied heavily on Queen's iconic songs, but failed to provide depth or insight into the band's journey, ultimately feeling like a missed opportunity to truly celebrate their legacy.

metadata.description: The Special Edition of the 2018 game Red Dead Redemption II came as a retail and downloadable version and included:
metadata.title: Red Dead Redemption II (Special Edition)

analysis.summary: While the game impresses with its vast world, compelling characters, and immersive features, it's hindered by clunky controls, repetitive looting mechanics, and a lack of innovation in combat, feeling like a missed opportunity to evolve gameplay. Despite these flaws, the game's strong writing, rich environment, and abundance of content make it a recommended experience for those seeking a well-crafted narrative-driven adventure.

metadata.name: Castlevania
metadata.overview: A dark medieval fantasy following the last surviving member of the disgraced Belmont clan, trying to save Eastern Europe from extinction at the hand of Vlad Dracula Tepe himself. Inspired by the classic video game series.

analysis.summary: While the series impresses with its compelling story, characters, and dark tone, it suffers from pacing issues and filler dialogue due to an increased episode count. The animation quality is exceptional, although some fight scenes suffer from choppy animation and mismatched sound effects. Overall, it's a fantastic show with superb fight choreography and gripping action sequences.

metadata.title: Overlord
metadata.overview: France, June 1944. On the eve of D-Day, some American paratroopers fall behind enemy lines after their aircraft crashes while on a mission to destroy a radio tower in a small village near the beaches of Normandy. After reaching their target, the surviving paratroopers realise that, in addition to fighting the Nazi troops that patrol the village, they also must fight against something else.

analysis.summary: While the show offers some fun moments, interesting characters, and a compelling premise, it suffers from frequent and jarring CGI, lackluster fight scenes, and a tendency to focus on trivial storylines, resulting in missed potential and pacing issues. Despite its shortcomings, it still provides entertainment, particularly for fans of the video game setting and anime cliches.

metadata.name: Attack on Titan
metadata.overview: Several hundred years ago, humans were nearly exterminated by Titans. Titans are typically several stories tall, seem to have no intelligence, devour human beings and, worst of all, seem to do it for the pleasure rather than as a food source. A small percentage of humanity survived by walling themselves in a city protected by extremely high walls, even taller than the biggest Titans. Flash forward to the present and the city has not seen a Titan in over 100 years. Teenage boy Eren and his foster sister Mikasa witness something horrific as the city walls are destroyed by a Colossal Titan that appears out of thin air. As the smaller Titans flood the city, the two kids watch in horror as their mother is eaten alive. Eren vows that he will murder every single Titan and take revenge for all of mankind.

analysis.summary: While the show balances despair and hope exceptionally well with impressive animation, soundtrack, and emotional depth, it suffers from excessive exposition, pacing issues, and lackluster character development, particularly with the main character. Despite these flaws, it remains a must-see for its compelling story, stunning action scenes, and overall quality.

metadata.title: Halloween
metadata.overview: Laurie Strode comes to her final confrontation with Michael Myers, the masked figure who has haunted her since she narrowly escaped his killing spree on Halloween night four decades ago.

analysis.summary: While the film offers plenty of creative kills and a compelling dynamic between the protagonist and antagonist, it suffers from some horror clichés and questionable character decisions, particularly towards the end. Overall, it's a competent modern slasher that does justice to the franchise and is worth seeing for fans of the genre.

metadata.description: Community Operations is a free to download DLC for the 2013 game Battlefield 4, which introduces a new map for multi-player set in an Indonesian jungle: Operation Outbreak. This map was available for download after the Fall 2015 patch update. This map was previously known as the Community Map Project, which was created in heavy collaboration with the Battlefield community.
metadata.title: Battlefield 4: Community Operations

analysis.summary: While the lack of a campaign is celebrated, the multiplayer modes, particularly the blackout mode, offer a highly enjoyable experience with some minor flaws like poor sound design and map clutter. Despite being compared to Fortnite, the game is praised for its fast-paced action and overall fun, making it one of the best multiplayer experiences currently available.

videos.title: Bad Times at the El Royale

metadata.title: Bad Times at the El Royale
metadata.original_title: Bad Times at the El Royale
metadata.overview: Lake Tahoe, 1969. Seven strangers, each one with a secret to bury, meet at El Royale, a decadent motel with a dark past. In the course of a fateful night, everyone will have one last shot at redemption.

analysis.summary: While the movie starts strong with an intriguing plot and unique narrative structure, it ultimately falls short in the latter half, becoming a more generic crime drama. However, the exceptional performances, particularly by Jeff Bridges and the character Myles, elevate the overall experience, making it a solid watch despite its flaws.

metadata.title: My Hero Academia: Two Heroes
metadata.original_title: 僕のヒーローアカデミア THE MOVIE ～2人の英雄～
metadata.overview: All Might and Deku accept an invitation to go abroad to a floating and mobile manmade city, called 'I-Island', where they research quirks as well as hero supplemental items at the special 'I-Expo' convention that is currently being held on the island. During that time, suddenly, despite an iron wall of security surrounding the island, the system is breached by a villain, and the only ones able to stop him are the students of Class 1-A.

analysis.summary: While the anime excels in delivering fun and imaginative fights with exceptional animation and soundtrack, it sometimes falls short in filler episodes and repetitive inspirational moments. However, the strong character development, particularly among the villains, and overall enjoyable experience make it a must-watch for anime fans.

metadata.name: Steins;Gate 0
metadata.original_name: シュタインズ・ゲート ゼロ
metadata.overview:
The dark untold story of Steins;Gate that leads with the eccentric mad scientist Okabe, struggling to recover from a failed attempt at rescuing Kurisu. He decides to give up and abandons his lively scientist alter ego, in pursuit to forget the past.
