When all seems to be normal, he is seemingly pulled back into the past by meeting an acquaintance of Kurisu, who tells him that they have begun testing a device that stores the memory of a human and creates a simulation of them with their characteristics and personalities. Okabe begins testing and finds out that the simulation of Kurisu has brought back anguish and some new unexpected tragedies.

Zero is a side story that explores events from the Beta Attractor Field's future that contribute in making the end of the original story possible.

analysis.summary: While the anime delivers a satisfying continuation of the beloved series with great characters and visuals, it suffers from a convoluted storyline in the beginning and lackluster action scenes. However, for fans of the original series, it's definitely worth watching to dive back into the world of time-traveling adventures.

metadata.title: Venom
metadata.overview: Investigative journalist Eddie Brock attempts a comeback following a scandal, but accidentally becomes the host of Venom, a violent, super powerful alien symbiote. Soon, he must rely on his newfound powers to protect the world from a shadowy organization looking for a symbiote of their own.

metadata.title: Hell Fest
metadata.overview: On Halloween night at a horror theme park, a costumed killer begins slaying innocent patrons who believe that it's all part of the festivities.

metadata.title: Assassination Nation
metadata.overview: After an anonymous hacker begins leaking the private data of thousands living in a small American town, the townspeople spiral into madness, with four high school seniors at the center of the maelstrom.

analysis.summary: While the movie has a promising concept and some enjoyable moments of action, it ultimately falls short due to its heavy-handed delivery of political messages, cringe-worthy dialogue, and juvenile attempts at making statements. Despite decent acting, the overuse of monologues and poorly written speeches detracts from its potential.

metadata.title: The Predator
metadata.overview: When a young boy accidentally triggers the universe's most lethal hunters' return to Earth, only a ragtag crew of ex-soldiers and a disgruntled scientist can prevent the end of the human race.

analysis.summary: While the movie's story, characters, and action are all objectively bad, it's surprisingly enjoyable due to its unintentional comedy and self-awareness. Despite its flaws, it offers a hilariously entertaining experience, making it worth watching for those seeking a fun, albeit poorly executed, movie.

metadata.description: This DLC for LEGO Marvel Avengers includes 8 new characters and outfits: Spider-Man, Peter Parker, Spider-Man (Miles Morales), Miles Morales, Spider-Man (Civil War), Iron Spider, Scarlet Spider and Spider-Girl.
metadata.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Spider-Man Character Pack

analysis.summary: While the combat and web-swinging mechanics are fantastic and the story is impressive, the game suffers from tedious and mundane missions, particularly in the early stages, and lackluster stealth sequences. However, the abundance of content and the engaging superhero experience make it a highly enjoyable game overall.

metadata.title: The Nun
metadata.overview: A priest with a haunted past and a novice on the threshold of her final vows are sent by the Vatican to investigate the death of a young nun in Romania and confront a malevolent force in the form of a demonic nun.

metadata.title: Searching
metadata.overview: After David Kim's 16-year-old daughter goes missing, a local investigation is opened and a detective is assigned to the case. But 37 hours later and without a single lead, David decides to search the one place no one has looked yet, where all secrets are kept today: his daughter's laptop.

analysis.summary: Despite initial skepticism, the movie surpassed my expectations with its clever use of the computer screen perspective and engaging plot twists. While it may not be everyone's cup of tea due to its realistic portrayal, it's undeniably one of the best mystery thriller movies in recent years, boasting superb writing and acting.

metadata.title: A-X-L
metadata.overview: The life of a teenage boy is forever altered by a chance encounter with cutting edge military technology.

analysis.summary: Despite its simplicity and lack of standout qualities, the movie exudes a nostalgic charm reminiscent of 90s family films. While it may not excel in dialogue or acting, it offers a fun and enjoyable experience, particularly for families seeking light entertainment.

metadata.title: The Happytime Murders
metadata.overview: In a world where human beings and puppets live together, when the members of the cast of a children's television show aired during the 1990s begin to get murdered one by one, puppet Phil Philips, a former LAPD detective who fell in disgrace and turned into a private eye, takes on the case at the request of his old boss in order to assist detective Edwards, who was his partner in the past.

analysis.summary: While the movie's universe and puppet performances were commendable, its weak writing and humor detracted significantly from the overall experience. Despite some potential and a few humorous moments, it ultimately fell short as a comedy, feeling lazy and relying too heavily on crude humor.

metadata.title: The Meg
metadata.overview: A deep sea submersible pilot revisits his past fears in the Mariana Trench, and accidentally unleashes the seventy foot ancestor of the Great White Shark believed to be extinct.

analysis.summary: While the movie delivers exactly what's expected from a big shark flick, with fun and mindless action scenes, it falls short in terms of acting and dialogue. Despite its flaws, it's an enjoyable ride that doesn't require much thought, featuring Jason Statham's entertaining performance and some thrilling encounters with the Megalodon.

metadata.title: Slender Man
metadata.overview: In a small town in Massachusetts, four high school girls perform a ritual in an attempt to debunk the lore of Slender Man. When one of the girls goes mysteriously missing, they begin to suspect that she is, in fact, his latest victim.

analysis.summary: The movie attempts to revive an outdated horror legend but falls short with a weak plot, unconvincing scares, and generic horror elements. Despite a few jump scares, it fails to deliver any genuine horror or substance, making it a forgettable and disappointing viewing experience.

metadata.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
metadata.overview: When an IMF mission ends badly, the world is faced with dire consequences. As Ethan Hunt takes it upon himself to fulfill his original briefing, the CIA begin to question his loyalty and his motives. The IMF team find themselves in a race against time, hunted by assassins while trying to prevent a global catastrophe.

analysis.summary: While the plot may feel recycled, the movie excels in delivering jaw-dropping action sequences and spectacular cinematography, thanks to Tom Cruise's commitment to performing his own stunts. Despite some formulaic elements and forced emotional moments, it succeeds in being an excellent and entertaining action film, arguably the best in the franchise.

videos.title: Teen Titans GO To the Movies

metadata.title: Teen Titans Go! To the Movies
metadata.original_title: Teen Titans Go! To the Movies
metadata.overview: All the major DC superheroes are starring in their own films, all but the Teen Titans, so Robin is determined to remedy this situation by getting over his role as a sidekick and becoming a movie star. Thus, with a few madcap ideas and an inspirational song in their hearts, the Teen Titans head to Hollywood to fulfill their dreams.

analysis.summary: This game is an absolute disaster in every aspect, from gameplay mechanics to storytelling, yet it manages to be entertaining due to its sheer awfulness. Despite its numerous flaws, including broken mechanics and uninspired enemies, the dialogue and voice acting provide a bizarre charm that makes it strangely enjoyable in a masochistic way.

metadata.title: Unfriended: Dark Web
metadata.overview: ​When a 20-something finds a cache of hidden files on his new laptop, he and his friends are unwittingly thrust into the depths of the dark web. They soon discover someone has been watching their every move and will go to unimaginable lengths to protect the dark web.

metadata.title: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania
metadata.overview: Super-Hero partners Scott Lang and Hope van Dyne, along with with Hope's parents Janet van Dyne and Hank Pym, and Scott's daughter Cassie Lang, find themselves exploring the Quantum Realm, interacting with strange new creatures and embarking on an adventure that will push them beyond the limits of what they thought possible.

analysis.summary: While the movie has some redeeming qualities such as good comedy writing and character dialogue, it falls short in terms of plot and action, feeling like a trivial addition to the MCU. Despite decent acting, the film lacks the substance and impact of other Marvel movies, making it feel like an afterthought in the franchise.

metadata.title: The First Purge
metadata.overview: To push the crime rate below one percent for the rest of the year, the New Founding Fathers of America test a sociological theory that vents aggression for one night in one isolated community. But when the violence of oppressors meets the rage of the others, the contagion will explode from the trial-city borders and spread across the nation.

analysis.summary: While the concept of the movie is intriguing and the main character is compelling, it falls short in execution with embarrassing attempts at horror and action. The overabundance of political commentary detracts from the overall experience, but the soundtrack stands out as a highlight.

metadata.title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom
metadata.overview: Three years after Jurassic World was destroyed, Isla Nublar now sits abandoned. When the island's dormant volcano begins roaring to life, Owen and Claire mount a campaign to rescue the remaining dinosaurs from this extinction-level event.

analysis.summary: While the movie's plot and writing are lacking, it offers mindless fun with a nostalgic 90s feel, filled with cascading bad events and dinosaur action. Despite its flaws, it's enjoyable to watch dinosaurs wreak havoc, making it a decently entertaining experience.

metadata.title: Hereditary
metadata.overview: Following the death of Ellen Leigh, the matriarch of their family, her daughter Annie and the rest of the family start to uncover disturbing secrets about their heritage.  Their daily lives are not only impacted, but they also become entangled in a chilling fate from which they cannot escape, driving them to the brink of madness.

analysis.summary: The acting in this movie is absolutely stellar, elevating the characters and making the story come alive. It effectively avoids overusing jump scares, opting instead for psychological horror, but falters in the last 10 minutes with generic horror tropes, detracting from an otherwise masterful experience.

metadata.title: Incredibles 2
metadata.overview: Elastigirl springs into action to save the day, while Mr. Incredible faces his greatest challenge yet – taking care of the problems of his three children.

metadata.description: This compilation of the Jurassic World: Evolution games contains:
metadata.title: Jurassic World: Evolution - Jurassic Park Edition

analysis.summary: While the game runs smoothly and has impressive visuals and sound design, it suffers from a severe lack of depth and features, feeling more like a hollow experience underneath its surface. Despite enjoyable aspects like managing dinosaur happiness and natural disasters, it's ultimately disappointing and overpriced for what it offers.

metadata.title: Upgrade
metadata.overview: A brutal mugging leaves Grey Trace paralyzed in the hospital and his beloved wife dead. A billionaire inventor soon offers Trace a cure — an artificial intelligence implant called STEM that will enhance his body. Now able to walk, Grey finds that he also has superhuman strength and agility — skills he uses to seek revenge against the thugs who destroyed his life.

analysis.summary: This movie is a breath of fresh air in a landscape dominated by big-budget blockbusters, delivering an incredible experience despite its modest budget. The action scenes are spectacular, with a unique concept and dynamic between the protagonist and an AI system. Additionally, the world-building is impressive, offering a glimpse into a believable future with intriguing technology.

metadata.description: What does it mean to be human? The looks? The emotions? The choices one makes? In this tale set in 2038 Detroit, the player takes control of three different androids and takes them on a journey to discover what becoming human is all about. Each of the protagonists has its own story and consequences that come with choices selected and actions made by the player.
metadata.title: Detroit: Become Human

analysis.summary: This game offers an abundance of choices that significantly impact the story, providing a unique experience for each player. While the visuals, animations, and sound design are superb, the gameplay feels limited and clunky, resembling more of an interactive movie than a traditional game. Despite flaws in writing and gameplay, it's enjoyable to play and offers plenty of opportunities for humor and exploration.

metadata.title: Solo: A Star Wars Story
metadata.overview: Through a series of daring escapades deep within a dark and dangerous criminal underworld, Han Solo meets his mighty future copilot Chewbacca and encounters the notorious gambler Lando Calrissian.

analysis.summary: This movie pleasantly surprised me with its quality despite my initial low expectations, standing out as the best Disney Star Wars film so far. While it excels in creating an enjoyable adventure with stunning visuals and solid performances, it lacks depth in character development and suffers from forced humor and cliched themes.

metadata.title: Deadpool 2
metadata.overview: Wisecracking mercenary Deadpool battles the evil and powerful Cable and other bad guys to save a boy's life.

analysis.summary: While the movie starts a bit slow with overused references, it quickly picks up momentum and delivers great action and comedy, with standout performances from most characters. Despite occasional poor CGI and a weak initial half hour, it's a highly entertaining film with jokes that hit hard and solid action sequences.

metadata.title: Bad Samaritan
metadata.overview: A thief makes a disturbing discovery in the house where he breaks in. Later, when he returns to the same house with his partner in crime, things are no longer how he expected.

analysis.summary: Despite lacking marketing and struggling at the box office, the movie delivers solid thrills with logical decision-making and well-fleshed-out characters. While it drags at times and includes some silly scenes, overall, it's a refreshing thriller that executes the formula well and deserves more attention.

metadata.title: Avengers: Infinity War
metadata.overview: As the Avengers and their allies have continued to protect the world from threats too large for any one hero to handle, a new danger has emerged from the cosmic shadows: Thanos. A despot of intergalactic infamy, his goal is to collect all six Infinity Stones, artifacts of unimaginable power, and use them to inflict his twisted will on all of reality. Everything the Avengers have fought for has led up to this moment - the fate of Earth and existence itself has never been more uncertain.

analysis.summary: Despite some major issues with certain characters and pacing, the movie excels in delivering a complex villain, impressive visuals, and a satisfying ending. With standout performances and a strong sense of humor, it's the best superhero movie the reviewer has seen, although it falls just short of a perfect score due to significant flaws.

metadata.description: God of War is set in the age of ancient Greek myths. The hero of the game is a mortal warrior Kratos. Long time ago, Kratos was the leader of Spartans, a fearless and brutal general who waged wars for the glory of his city. Today, he is known as the Ghost of Sparta. For the past ten years, he is tormented with terrible nightmares, unable to forget the tragedy that happened in his past. He has to serve the gods of Olympus, who promised to forgive his sins if he becomes their champion. Finally, the goddess Athene tells Kratos that redemption will be granted to him if he defeats her brother, the god of war Ares, who was the very reason for the tragic event of his past...
metadata.title: God of War

analysis.summary: The game impresses with breathtaking visuals, engaging side quests, and a deep combat system, although some enemy designs feel uninspired and certain puzzle sections could have been shortened for better pacing. Despite these flaws, the game offers a world rich in lore, replayability, and a standout first boss battle that sets a high standard for the rest of the game.

metadata.title: I Feel Pretty
metadata.overview: A head injury causes a woman to develop an extraordinary amount of confidence and believe she's drop dead gorgeous.

metadata.title: Truth or Dare
metadata.overview: A harmless game of "Truth or Dare" among friends turns deadly when someone—or something—begins to punish those who tell a lie—or refuse the dare.

metadata.title: Rampage
metadata.overview: Primatologist Davis Okoye shares an unshakable bond with George, the extraordinarily intelligent, silverback gorilla who has been in his care since birth.  But a rogue genetic experiment gone awry mutates this gentle ape into a raging creature of enormous size.  To make matters worse, it’s soon discovered there are other similarly altered animals.  As these newly created alpha predators tear across North America, destroying everything in their path, Okoye teams with a discredited genetic engineer to secure an antidote, fighting his way through an ever-changing battlefield, not only to halt a global catastrophe but to save the fearsome creature that was once his friend.

analysis.summary: The movie captures the spirit of the game with entertaining action sequences and a fun premise, although it lacks depth in its plot and pacing. Despite its flaws, it's a satisfyingly enjoyable film that delivers on its promise of giant monsters wreaking havoc.

metadata.title: A Quiet Place
metadata.overview: A family is forced to live in silence while hiding from creatures that hunt by sound.

analysis.summary: This horror movie stands out with its intelligent characters, phenomenal acting, and constant tension-building. While there are minor nitpicks like logical inconsistencies and the design of the monsters, it's overall a breath of fresh air in the genre and easily one of the best horror movies in recent years.

metadata.title: Ready Player One
metadata.overview: When the creator of a popular video game system dies, a virtual contest is created to compete for his fortune.

metadata.title: Pacific Rim: Uprising
metadata.overview: It has been ten years since The Battle of the Breach and the oceans are still, but restless. Vindicated by the victory at the Breach, the Jaeger program has evolved into the most powerful global defense force in human history. The PPDC now calls upon the best and brightest to rise up and become the next generation of heroes when the Kaiju threat returns.

analysis.summary: This sequel disappoints with its convoluted plot, lackluster action scenes, and laughably bad main villain, overshadowing its stunning visuals and decent performances. While it may appeal to some fans of the franchise, it ultimately falls short of living up to the first movie's standards and feels like a step back in every way.

metadata.title: Tomb Raider
metadata.overview: Lara Croft, the fiercely independent daughter of a missing adventurer, must push herself beyond her limits when she finds herself on the island where her father disappeared.

analysis.summary: While flawed with nonsensical scenes and some weak acting, this movie delivers a visually appealing adventure with a simple, faithful adaptation of the video game. It's a competent and enjoyable adventure movie, particularly for fans of the game series.

metadata.title: A Wrinkle in Time
metadata.overview: After the disappearance of her scientist father, three peculiar beings send Meg, her brother, and her friend to space in order to find him.

metadata.title: Red Sparrow
metadata.overview: Prima ballerina Dominika Egorova faces a bleak and uncertain future after she suffers an injury that ends her career. She soon turns to Sparrow School, a secret intelligence service that trains exceptional young people to use their minds and bodies as weapons. Dominika emerges as the most dangerous Sparrow after completing the sadistic training process. As she comes to terms with her new abilities, she meets a CIA agent who tries to convince her that he is the only person she can trust.

analysis.summary: While the conclusion of the movie is impressive, the overall experience is marred by a convoluted plot, uninteresting characters, and an excessive reliance on explicit scenes that fail to engage. Despite Jennifer Lawrence's strong performance, the film suffers from disjointed pacing and scenes that lack meaningful impact, resulting in a forgettable and dull viewing experience.

metadata.title: Annihilation
metadata.overview: A biologist signs up for a dangerous, secret expedition into a mysterious zone where the laws of nature don't apply.

metadata.title: Black Panther
metadata.overview: King T'Challa returns home to the reclusive, technologically advanced African nation of Wakanda to serve as his country's new leader. However, T'Challa soon finds that he is challenged for the throne by factions within his own country as well as without. Using powers reserved to Wakandan kings, T'Challa assumes the Black Panther mantle to join with ex-girlfriend Nakia, the queen-mother, his princess-kid sister, members of the Dora Milaje (the Wakandan 'special forces') and an American secret agent, to prevent Wakanda from being dragged into a world war.

analysis.summary: The movie impressed with its stunning visuals and exceptional score, making it one of Marvel's most visually breathtaking entries. While it lacked in effective comedy and suffered from some action scenes with overly quick cuts, it stood out with a compelling villain and a solid story, albeit one that didn't fully impact the larger Marvel Cinematic Universe until the end.

metadata.title: Fifty Shades Freed
metadata.overview: Believing they have left behind shadowy figures from their past, newlyweds Christian and Ana fully embrace an inextricable connection and shared life of luxury. But just as she steps into her role as Mrs. Grey and he relaxes into an unfamiliar stability, new threats could jeopardize their happy ending before it even begins.

metadata.title: The Cloverfield Paradox
metadata.overview: Orbiting above a planet on the brink of war, scientists test a device to solve an energy crisis and end up face-to-face with a dark alternate reality.

metadata.title: Winchester
metadata.overview: San Jose, California, 1906. Isolated in her labyrinthine mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester believes that she is being haunted by the souls of those killed by the guns manufactured by her company.

metadata.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure
metadata.overview: Thomas leads his group of escaped Gladers on their final and most dangerous mission yet. To save their friends, they must break into the legendary Last City, a WCKD-controlled labyrinth that may turn out to be the deadliest maze of all. Anyone who makes it out alive will get answers to the questions the Gladers have been asking since they first arrived in the maze.

analysis.summary: While the movie's visuals were impressive and it handled character deaths well, the nonsensical plot, frustrating decision-making, and lazy storytelling tropes detracted from its overall quality. Despite offering closure to the trilogy, it falls short of being a good movie, bordering on below average due to its numerous flaws.

metadata.title: Paddington 2
metadata.overview: Paddington, now happily settled with the Browns, picks up a series of odd jobs to buy the perfect present for his Aunt Lucy, but it is stolen.

analysis.summary: Despite initially hesitating due to emotional vulnerability, I found the movie to be surprisingly amazing, with superb cinematography, wholesome humor, and a heartfelt storyline that resonated deeply. While not reaching the level of a groundbreaking masterpiece, it excelled in all areas and provided a thoroughly enjoyable experience, earning a high rating on the moist meter.

metadata.title: The Commuter
metadata.overview: A businessman, on his daily commute home, gets unwittingly caught up in a criminal conspiracy that threatens not only his life but the lives of those around him.

analysis.summary: While the movie didn't excel in originality or suspense, it provided a decent dose of entertaining action with some predictable but enjoyable plot twists. Liam Neeson's performance adds to the fun, despite the formulaic nature of the film, making it worth a watch for fans of mindless action movies.

metadata.title: Insidious: The Last Key
metadata.overview: Parapsychologist Elise Rainier and her team travel to Five Keys, NM, to investigate a man’s claim of a haunting. Terror soon strikes when Rainier realizes that the house he lives in was her family’s old home.

analysis.summary: The movie failed to deliver on many fronts, with a lackluster plot, bad characters, and overreliance on jump scares. Despite a few scenes that built tension and a potentially interesting villain concept, the overall execution fell flat, leaving it as a disappointing entry in the franchise.

metadata.title: Bright
metadata.overview: In an alternate present-day where magical creatures live among us, two L.A. cops become embroiled in a prophesied turf battle.

analysis.summary: While acknowledging its flaws, I found this movie to be enjoyable and fun, offering a refreshing take on the action-comedy genre. Despite some bad writing and jokes that didn't quite land, the movie's cheesy premise and entertaining action sequences made it a worthwhile watch.

metadata.title: Pitch Perfect 3
metadata.overview: After the highs of winning the world championships, the Bellas find themselves split apart and discovering there aren't job prospects for making music with your mouth. But when they get the chance to reunite for an overseas USO tour, this group of awesome nerds will come together to make some music, and some questionable decisions, one last time.

metadata.title: Star Wars: The Last Jedi
metadata.overview: Rey develops her newly discovered abilities with the guidance of Luke Skywalker, who is unsettled by the strength of her powers. Meanwhile, the Resistance prepares to do battle with the First Order.

analysis.summary: While acknowledging its flaws and plot holes, this movie offered some enjoyment and potential, especially for Star Wars fans. Despite the disappointing villain and unresolved questions, there were still moments of fun and inspiration, making it worth a watch, though not without its drawbacks.

metadata.title: The Disaster Artist
metadata.overview: An aspiring actor in Hollywood meets an enigmatic stranger by the name of Tommy Wiseau, the meeting leads the actor down a path nobody could have predicted; creating the worst movie ever made.

analysis.summary: The movie provided an enjoyable and uplifting experience, with a strong story of friendship and following dreams. Despite not being a gut-busting comedy, it was entertaining and well-executed, with a cast that showed passion for the original material.

metadata.title: Hey Arnold! The Jungle Movie
metadata.overview: When their trip to San Lorenzo takes a turn for the worst, Arnold and his classmate’s only hope of getting home is retracing the dangerous path that led to Arnold's parents' disappearance.

metadata.title: Justice League
metadata.overview: Fuelled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman's selfless act, Bruce Wayne and Diana Prince assemble a team of metahumans consisting of Barry Allen, Arthur Curry and Victor Stone to face the catastrophic threat of Steppenwolf and the Parademons who are on the hunt for three Mother Boxes on Earth.

metadata.description: Star Wars: Battlefront II is the sequel to Star Wars: Battlefront in terms of franchise and multiplayer, but unlike its predecessor, this game features an original campaign that bridges a gap in the main canon story between the Episode VI and Episode VII movies. The campaign follows the story of Iden Versio, leader of an Imperial special forces team known as Inferno Squad. You are who Stormtroopers call when they're in trouble, and Rebels know you well enough to fear you. As the story starts somewhere during Episode VI, after a couple of introductory missions you are dispatched on Endor, a satellite-moon where the shield array for the Death Star is, and Han Solo with a group of rebels is about to take it out so that Rebel X-Wings can attack the Death Star. You are too late and the Death Star is destroyed... and as we know from the movie, the Emperor along with it, even though Darth Vader killed him before the explosion, unknown to Iden. As a true believer in the Empire, Iden's plan is to avenge the Emperor and bring the Rebels to their knees.
metadata.title: Star Wars: Battlefront II

metadata.description: This is a winter sports game that lets you compete in five Olympic events: Downhill skiing, Biathlon, Slalom, Ski Jump and Bob Sled. It is very similar to offerings like Winter Games from Epyx.
metadata.title: Winter Challenge: World Class Competition

analysis.summary: The campaign is heavily criticized for its miserable storyline and repetitive missions, although the graphics and voice acting receive praise. Multiplayer feels familiar to previous Call of Duty games, lacking innovation, while Nazi Zombies mode is enjoyable but offers little new. Overall, it's a functional game with an established formula that appeals to fans of the series, but it's not personally enjoyable for the reviewer.

metadata.title: Thor: Ragnarok
metadata.overview: Thor is imprisoned on the other side of the universe and finds himself in a race against time to get back to Asgard to stop Ragnarok, the destruction of his home-world and the end of Asgardian civilization, at the hands of a powerful new threat, the ruthless Hela.

analysis.summary: While the previous Thor movies were disliked, this one pleasantly surprised me with its comedy, visuals, and impact on the MCU universe. The storyline, though predictable, was well-executed, and the standout character Korg added to the enjoyment. Despite minor flaws like the shoehorned zombie army, it was a genuinely fun and refreshing addition to the MCU.

metadata.description: In this game, the player takes control of a lone prisoner who has been taken captive in a large castle occupied by the Nazis. Getting out of the cell and picking up a weapon is just the beginning; the ultimate goal is to acquire the war plans of the Nazis, and escape from Castle Wolfenstein alive.
metadata.title: Castle Wolfenstein

analysis.summary: The game offers a fun and well-written experience with enjoyable gunplay, diverse levels, and a fitting soundtrack. However, pacing issues with excessive cutscenes and an uninspired hub world detract from the overall experience. Despite this, it's a competent FPS with high testosterone action that most players will enjoy.

metadata.title: Jigsaw
metadata.overview: Law enforcement finds itself chasing the ghost of a man dead for over a decade, embroiled in a diabolical new game that's only just begun.

analysis.summary: The movie is filled with plot holes and over-the-top gore, leading to an underwhelming experience overall. While the story has some interesting twists, it feels like a rehash of previous entries in the franchise. Fans of the series may find some redeeming qualities, but it's unlikely to impress those looking for something new in the horror genre.

metadata.title: The Snowman
metadata.overview: A young boy makes a snowman one Christmas Eve, which comes to life at midnight and takes him on a magical adventure to the North Pole to meet Santa Claus.

analysis.summary: The movie is a convoluted mess with horrible editing, sound, and dubbing, despite having a potentially interesting premise and setting. While the visuals and setting are decent, the overall execution is so bad that it's not even worth watching for a 'so bad it's good' experience.

metadata.description: This pre-order retail release includes the base game and a bonus DLC, namely:
metadata.title: The Evil Within 2

analysis.summary: While the game has enjoyable aspects like its atmosphere, soundtrack, and certain characters, it suffers from numerous flaws including uninspired voice acting, clunky gameplay, and weak level design. Despite being slightly above average and offering a decent amount of content, it falls short of being a standout title due to its glaring issues across various departments.

metadata.title: The Foreigner
metadata.overview: Quan is a humble London businessman whose long-buried past erupts in a revenge-fueled vendetta when the only person left for him to love – his teenage daughter – dies in an Irish Republican Army car bombing. His relentless search to find the terrorists leads to a cat-and-mouse conflict with a British government official whose own past may hold the clues to the identities of the elusive killers.

analysis.summary: While the movie delivers on its action-packed scenes and features strong performances from Jackie Chan and Pierce Brosnan, it suffers from pacing issues and a lack of clear direction, alternating between revenge plot and political thriller. Despite these flaws, the story is engaging, the characters are well-developed, and overall, it's an enjoyable experience.

metadata.title: Happy Death Day
metadata.overview: Caught in a bizarre and terrifying time warp, college student Tree finds herself repeatedly reliving the day of her murder, ultimately realizing that she must identify the killer and the reason for her death before her chances of survival run out.

analysis.summary: While the movie lacks significant scares and doesn't break new ground, it delivers a pleasant and enjoyable experience with decent acting and a simple yet effective storyline. Despite some flaws in the plot, it's a fun watch that doesn't take itself too seriously, offering a laid-back moviegoing experience.

metadata.description: The leader of S.H.A.D.O.W., the world's largest criminal organization, has been murdered. Choose one of the seven fighters available and fight your way to be named the next Shadow King. The game is a 2D versus fighting game with digitized fighters and backgrounds, some 'special' moves per character, and zooming effects during battles.
metadata.title: Shadow: War of Succession

analysis.summary: While the game suffers from a weak story and disappointing business practices with its lootcrate system, the gameplay shines with a fantastic nemesis system and enjoyable combat mechanics. The orcs add depth and personality, while the diverse settings and easy traversal enhance the overall experience.

metadata.title: Blade Runner 2049
metadata.overview: Thirty years after the events of the first film, a new blade runner, LAPD Officer K, unearths a long-buried secret that has the potential to plunge what's left of society into chaos. K's discovery leads him on a quest to find Rick Deckard, a former LAPD blade runner who has been missing for 30 years.

metadata.description: This compilation includes:
metadata.title: Cuphead & Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course

analysis.summary: The game's stunning visual style and challenging yet fair gameplay make it an absolute joy to play, with a soundtrack that adds to the overall experience. While some bosses rely heavily on trial and error, and the running gun sections feel less fleshed out, these minor complaints don't detract much from the overall fantastic experience.

metadata.title: American Made
metadata.overview: The true story of pilot Barry Seal, who transported contraband for the CIA and the Medellin cartel in the 1980s.

analysis.summary: I enjoyed the intriguing story, albeit with some liberties taken, especially regarding the chaotic editing and shaky camera work, yet the portrayal of the cartel as affable characters was a highlight. Despite excessive focus on the lead actor's smile, the film provided a decently entertaining experience with good acting overall.

metadata.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle
metadata.overview: When an attack on the Kingsman headquarters takes place and a new villain rises, Eggsy and Merlin are forced to work together with the American agency known as the Statesman to save the world.

analysis.summary: I appreciated the continuation of the over-the-top action and nods to the first film, alongside standout performances from Elton John and Pedro Pascal, but found the story and character development lacking, with many new characters feeling underutilized. Despite its flaws, fans of the original will likely enjoy the sequel's style and main characters' presence, making it a solid watch overall.

Despite appreciating the clever concept and symbolism, the film falls short due to poor execution, uninteresting storytelling, and nauseating camera work, resulting in a tedious and boring viewing experience. While the message may be decipherable with effort, it fails to make the movie enjoyable or worth recommending.

While the game improves on storytelling and delivers enjoyable gunplay with stunning visuals and a noteworthy soundtrack, it lacks significant differentiation from its predecessor and suffers from uninspired character development. The raid, although fun overall, is marred by a frustratingly designed segment that detracts from the overall experience.

metadata.name: It
metadata.overview: In 1960, seven outcast kids known as "The Losers' Club" fight an evil demon who poses as a child-killing clown. Thirty years later, they reunite to stop the demon once and for all when it returns to their hometown.

analysis.summary: Despite some minor flaws like a prolonged final confrontation and occasional goofy moments, the movie impresses with its fantastic storytelling, genuine creepiness, and well-written characters, making it a standout in the horror genre. With a refreshing approach that avoids over-reliance on jump scares and delivers genuine scares, it's a must-watch for horror enthusiasts.

metadata.title: Birth of the Dragon
metadata.overview: Set against the backdrop of San Francisco’s Chinatown, this cross-cultural biopic chronicles Bruce Lee’s emergence as a martial-arts superstar after his legendary secret showdown with fellow martial artist Wong Jack Man.

analysis.summary: This movie fails to honor its subject matter, presenting a disappointing narrative with poorly developed characters and subpar fight choreography. Despite strong casting choices for the main characters, the overall execution is abysmal, resulting in a deeply unsatisfying viewing experience.

metadata.title: Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard
metadata.overview: The world’s most lethal odd couple – bodyguard Michael Bryce and hitman Darius Kincaid – are back on another life-threatening mission. Still unlicensed and under scrutiny, Bryce is forced into action by Darius's even more volatile wife, the infamous international con artist Sonia Kincaid. As Bryce is driven over the edge by his two most dangerous protectees, the trio get in over their heads in a global plot and soon find that they are all that stand between Europe and a vengeful and powerful madman.

metadata.title: Annabelle: Creation
metadata.overview: Several years after the tragic death of their little girl, a doll maker and his wife welcome a nun and several girls from a shuttered orphanage into their home, soon becoming the target of the doll maker's possessed creation—Annabelle.

analysis.summary: While the movie follows the standard formula for modern horror films with predictable jump scares and clichéd characters, it still manages to deliver an effective and decently creepy experience. The tie-ins to other horror movies in the Blum House universe add an interesting dimension, but ultimately, it's a familiar ride with few surprises.

metadata.title: The Dark Tower
metadata.overview: A boy haunted by visions of a parallel world aids its disillusioned guardian in preventing the destruction of the nexus of universes known as the Dark Tower.

analysis.summary: The movie's only redeeming qualities lie in its cool reloading sequences and its unintentional entertainment value derived from its laughably bad dialogue and poorly executed action scenes. However, the story is poorly told, the characters are uninteresting, and the overall execution is subpar, making it a dismal viewing experience.

metadata.title: Atomic Blonde
metadata.overview: An undercover MI6 agent is sent to Berlin during the Cold War to investigate the murder of a fellow agent and recover a missing list of double agents.

metadata.title: The Emoji Movie
metadata.overview: Gene, a multi-expressional emoji, sets out on a journey to become a normal emoji.

metadata.title: Valerian
metadata.overview: When a chance meeting brings together the disconnected existences of two parties living either side of a desolate river's estuary, a bizarre relationship is born. However as time passes, what may truly seem like a token of one party's affection may only be the object of their darkest desires.

metadata.title: Wish Upon
metadata.overview: A teenage girl discovers a box with magical powers, but those powers comes with a deadly price.

videos.title: War for the Planet of the Apes

metadata.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
metadata.original_title: War for the Planet of the Apes
metadata.overview: Caesar and his apes are forced into a deadly conflict with an army of humans led by a ruthless Colonel. After the apes suffer unimaginable losses, Caesar wrestles with his darker instincts and begins his own mythic quest to avenge his kind. As the journey finally brings them face to face, Caesar and the Colonel are pitted against each other in an epic battle that will determine the fate of both their species and the future of the planet.

analysis.summary: While the movie suffers from some major flaws like the poorly guarded military base and excessive slow-motion scenes, it offers a solid conclusion to the trilogy with a compelling storyline and well-developed characters. The action scenes are visually impressive, and the soundtrack adds to the overall mood, making it a worthwhile watch despite its shortcomings.

metadata.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
metadata.overview: Following the events of Captain America: Civil War, Peter Parker, with the help of his mentor Tony Stark, tries to balance his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens, New York City, with fighting crime as his superhero alter ego Spider-Man as a new threat, the Vulture, emerges.

analysis.summary: While the movie excels in portraying Peter Parker's high school life and character development, it falls short in delivering memorable action scenes, making the overall experience underwhelming in that aspect. Despite this, Tom Holland's portrayal of Spider-Man and Michael Keaton's performance as Vulture are standout aspects, contributing to a solid superhero movie worth watching.

metadata.title: Baby Driver
metadata.overview: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver finds himself taking part in a heist doomed to fail.

metadata.title: Transformers: The Last Knight
metadata.overview: Autobots and Decepticons are at war, with humans on the sidelines. Optimus Prime is gone. The key to saving our future lies buried in the secrets of the past, in the hidden history of Transformers on Earth.

analysis.summary: While the movie features some cool characters like Anthony Hopkins and cogman, it fails to deliver engaging action, a coherent storyline, or satisfying villain dynamics. The lackluster action scenes, underwhelming final battle, and overall mediocrity make it a disappointing experience, even for fans of the franchise.

metadata.title: The Mummy
metadata.overview: Though safely entombed in a crypt deep beneath the unforgiving desert, an ancient queen whose destiny was unjustly taken from her is awakened in our current day, bringing with her malevolence grown over millennia, and terrors that defy human comprehension.

metadata.title: Wonder Woman
metadata.overview: An Amazon princess comes to the world of Man in the grips of the First World War to confront the forces of evil and bring an end to human conflict.

analysis.summary: The movie delivers solid action and character development, offering a refreshing take on the superhero genre within the DC universe. While it doesn't reach extraordinary heights, it stands out as DC's best effort yet, striking a balance between darkness and entertainment.

metadata.title: Alien: Covenant
metadata.overview: The crew of the colony ship Covenant, bound for a remote planet on the far side of the galaxy, discovers what they think is an uncharted paradise but is actually a dark, dangerous world.

analysis.summary: While the story and themes are fascinating, the movie is hindered by the frustratingly unrealistic actions of its characters. Despite this, it offers intense action, visually stunning scenes, and a compelling ending that will satisfy fans of the series.

metadata.name: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
metadata.original_name: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
metadata.overview: Transforming patients' lives, at the cutting edge of medicine. Meet the world-leading surgeons pushing science - and the human body - to its limits.

metadata.description: Little Nightmares is a horror-themed platform game with puzzle elements. It is set in a humongous sea vessel called "The Maw", inhabited by strange, semi-human creatures. The player guides a small girl in a yellow raincoat, known as "Six", who seeks to escape the Maw. The game features varied, twisted scenery, from grimy industrial depths, to living areas with giant-sized furniture.
metadata.title: Little Nightmares

analysis.summary: The game offers a fantastic story, visually stunning environments, and intense hide-and-seek gameplay mechanics, creating a memorable and enjoyable experience. However, frustrating platforming elements and long loading times detract from the overall experience, but it's still worth the price for its short yet captivating gameplay.

metadata.name: Unforgettable
metadata.overview: Former Syracuse, New York, police detective Carrie Wells has hyperthymesia, a rare medical condition that gives her the ability to visually remember everything. She reluctantly joins the New York City Police Department's Queens homicide unit after her former boyfriend and partner asks for help with solving a case. The move allows her to try to find out the one thing she has been unable to remember, which is what happened the day her sister was murdered.

metadata.description: Following the style of its predecessor, the original Outlaw Golf, the game stays true to bad attitude, sexual themes and bunch of losers who just happen to find something in common to take upon - a game of golf. The magnificent four are back, Harley, Summer, El Suave and Ice Trey, with several more characters to be unlocked as you blast through the courses, speaking of which, the former three from the original are back, and again, with newer ones to be played after earned and unlocked. If you wanna practice your moves and skills, you can select exhibition mode, or if you feel contempt enough, go take a tour and show 'em what you're made of. There are several additions not seen in the original game, such as different game modes as well as golf cart racing which lets you earn the legendary burning shot, though the beating of your caddy to raise your composure is still included. The game also supports online play.
metadata.title: Outlaw Golf 2

analysis.summary: The game features a fantastic and intriguing story with well-written characters, visually stunning environments, and disturbingly brutal scenes. However, the gameplay's focus on chase sequences becomes repetitive, and the inconsistency of the hiding mechanics detracts from the overall experience. Despite these shortcomings, it offers solid tension-building mechanics and avoids relying solely on jump scares for scares, making it a standout horror game.

metadata.description: Syberia 3: The Complete Journey is a compilation of:
metadata.title: Syberia 3: The Complete Journey

analysis.summary: While the game has a compelling story, enjoyable puzzles, and an atmospheric environment, it suffers from clunky controls, outdated visuals, and abysmal voice acting. The camera and gameplay mechanics are inconsistent, leading to frustration and detracting from the overall experience. Despite offering some interesting elements, it ultimately falls short of being a good game, settling for average due to its technical shortcomings.

metadata.description: Yooka-Laylee: Buddy Duo Bundle is a compilation of:
metadata.title: Yooka-Laylee: Buddy Duo Bundle

analysis.summary: While the game offers nostalgia and some enjoyable aspects like dialogue and collectibles, it ultimately falls short with uninspired design, clunky controls, and a horrendous camera. The levels feel bland, characters are uninteresting, and the overall experience is more frustrating than fun, leading to disappointment despite high expectations.

metadata.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Tower of Doom is a 2D side-scrolling, weapon-based beat'em up game set in the Dungeons & Dragons Mystara campaign setting. The game has some slight RPG elements taken from the tabletop role-playing game. At the start of the game you can pick between 4 characters: cleric, dwarf, elf, and fighter. The game is very similar to Golden Axe - players go right, slash enemies (and various bosses) and use magic or additional weapons. Daggers, hammers, arrows and burning oil can be used as throwing weapons.
metadata.title: Dungeons & Dragons: Tower of Doom

analysis.summary: While the game impresses with its visual style, unique characters, and cool weapons, it suffers from balancing issues, network problems, and excessive, cringeworthy humor. Despite the effort put into its design, the game's shortcomings make it enjoyable only in small doses, with limited long-term appeal due to its lack of active community and potential for boredom.

metadata.description:
Inside a casino, during one of their heists, the group known as Phantom Thieves of Hearts is cornered by the police. Unable to escape, the leader of the group (the game's protagonist) is put under arrest, and goes into interrogation. Thus he begins to tell his story.
After defending a woman from being harassed by a powerful politician, the 16-year-old protagonist is charged with assault and put on probation, which results in expulsion from his school.
Following this, the protagonist is transferred to Shujin Academy in Tokyo, being forced to live at a coffee shop by the name of Cafe Leblanc, under the supervision of a friend of his parents, Sojiro Sakura.
After going to school and making a couple of friends, is when the story truly starts.
metadata.title: Persona 5

analysis.summary: While the game's main story may not be mind-blowing, the excellent dungeon crawling, turn-based combat, and well-written side stories make it a deeply enjoyable experience. With great voice acting, solid soundtrack, and a vast amount of content to explore, it's a must-play for fans of the series and those willing to invest time in a slow-building narrative.

metadata.title: Ghost in the Shell
metadata.overview: In the year 2029, the barriers of our world have been broken down by the net and by cybernetics, but this brings new vulnerability to humans in the form of brain-hacking. When a highly-wanted hacker known as 'The Puppetmaster' begins involving them in politics, Section 9, a group of cybernetically enhanced cops, are called in to investigate and stop the Puppetmaster.

analysis.summary: While the plot may be predictable and the villain lackluster, the movie excels in its stunning visuals, solid performances, and impressive soundtrack. It's an enjoyable watch, especially for those unfamiliar with the original series, providing a fun two-hour entertainment experience.

metadata.description: This Recruit Edition contains:
metadata.title: Mass Effect: Andromeda (Recruit Edition)

analysis.summary: While the combat was enjoyable and some missions were fun, the game suffers from predictable storytelling, cringe-worthy dialogue, and lackluster character interactions. Despite its issues, there's still some content to explore, making it slightly above average, but it's a disappointment compared to previous entries in the series.

I appreciated some aspects like the visuals, fighting scenes, and portrayal of certain spirits, but overall, the rushed narrative, weak dialogue, and lack of character development left much to be desired. While it exceeded my low expectations, it still fell short of being anything special and felt like a mediocre adaptation that struggled to justify its existence.

metadata.overview: Recently fired and desperate for work, a troubled young man named Mike agrees to take a position as a night security guard at an abandoned theme restaurant: Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria. But he soon discovers that nothing at Freddy's is what it seems.
metadata.title: Five Nights at Freddy's

analysis.summary: The movie has enjoyable moments, particularly for fans of the franchise, but suffers from disjointed storytelling and underdeveloped characters, particularly the cop character who serves primarily as an exposition tool. While some concepts are interesting, such as the protagonist's motivation, the execution falls short, resulting in a film that may entertain fans but struggles to stand out on its own.

While the season maintains the beautiful animation and action-packed sequences Demon Slayer is known for, it falls short in delivering compelling villains and emotional depth, with some characters feeling underdeveloped and fights lacking the intensity of previous seasons. However, it still introduces interesting narrative elements and characters, leaving room for excitement for future seasons despite being the weakest installment so far.

While the show captures the essence of the game well, with strong performances and faithful story beats, it misses some chemistry between key characters and lacks sufficient focus on the infected to maintain a sense of urgency. Despite these minor flaws, the show is an extraordinary adaptation that effectively introduces new characters and delivers a compelling narrative, though a more extended finale could have enhanced the overall impact.

videos.title: The Last of Us Part 1 Remake

analysis.summary: The remastered version impressively overhauls the visuals and combat mechanics, making it a smoother and more visually stunning experience. However, the decision to price it at $70 feels unjustified, especially considering the removal of multiplayer content and the lack of significant changes to the core game. Despite its high quality, the pricing and content decisions detract from its overall value.

I appreciated the character development of Butcher and Huey with superpowers, as well as Maeve's integral role in the plot, but found the excessive use of Compound V and underwhelming adult characters to be drawbacks. Additionally, the season suffered from some pacing issues and unnecessary plot elements, but overall, it set up an intriguing storyline for the conclusion and maintained an entertaining narrative, earning a solid 90 on the moist meter.

Season 2 delivers stunning animation and intense action sequences, particularly in the Entertainment District Arc. While character development is minimal, the show excels in showcasing power progression and maintaining its simple yet engaging plot. Overall, it amplifies the momentum from the first season and offers a thrilling, visually impressive experience for fans of the series.

I thoroughly enjoyed the second season, finding it significantly better than its predecessor, with impressive visuals, engaging action sequences, and emotional depth. Despite one lackluster episode, the rest of the season excelled in storytelling, character development, and world-building, reinvigorating my excitement for the Star Wars universe.

The PlayStation 5 offers a sleek UI, fast loading times, and a quiet operation, making it an impressive next-gen console. With a solid lineup of exclusive titles at launch and improved features like the new game bar edition and built-in PS Store, it provides a lot of value right out of the box. Despite minor issues like storage limitations and its size, the overall experience is highly satisfying and promises a bright future for next-gen gaming.

While the second season maintains strong narrative momentum and introduces compelling new characters, it falls short in fully developing the central villain from the first season. Despite this, the season still delivers entertaining and gory action, with standout moments in the final episodes setting up intriguing possibilities for the future.

Season three of the series elevated the stakes and delivered impactful storylines with surprising twists, particularly with the emotionally charged events like the red wedding. While some aspects like sword fighting were still lacking, the overall improvement in cinematography, writing, and character development made it one of the strongest seasons yet, earning a high rating on the moist meter.

videos.title: Billie Eilish - When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go

analysis.summary: I've faced challenges with my moist meter movie reviews being blocked worldwide on YouTube, but with help, I managed to fight back and win against wrongful claims. To ensure the reviews stay online, I plan to adjust the format, avoiding the use of movie trailers and opting for a different visual approach. This victory marks a positive step forward for YouTube content creators dealing with copyright issues.

The movie deviates significantly from its source material, lacking depth in characters and suffering from poor pacing. While attempting shock value with gore, it falls short, resulting in a lackluster experience overall. Despite its flaws, it may appeal to those who enjoy so-bad-it's-good movies, but it's ultimately not recommended.
